sponda: <entryFree id="n45096" type="main" key="sponda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n45096.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the frame</hi> of a bedstead, sofa, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 657</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 97, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">94, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45096.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45096.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">couch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sofa</hi> (syn. lectus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 698</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:22" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:345" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 345</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:91:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 91, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45096.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spondaeus: <entryFree id="n45097" type="main" key="spondaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spondaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. spondeus.</entryFree>
spondaicus: <entryFree id="n45098" type="greek" key="sponda^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spondăĭcus</orth>, v. spondiacus.</entryFree>
spondalium: <entryFree id="n45099" type="main" key="sponda_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spondālĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">spondaulĭum</orth> (the form is uncertain), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrificial hymn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompanied by the flute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spondalium canere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 472 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">spondalia dicens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 193</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
spondeo: <entryFree id="n45100" type="main" key="sponde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spondĕo</orth>, <itype>spŏpondi, sponsum, 2</itype> (<sense id="n45100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> spepondi, Cic., Caes., and Val. Antias ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4358</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">without redup. sponderat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Mart. 3, 135</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> sponsis = spoponderis, an ancient formula of prayer in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=351" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 351</bibl> Müll.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>akin with <foreign lang="greek">spe/ndw</foreign>, to pour out, = libare; cf. <foreign lang="greek">spondai/</foreign>, league</etym>. </sense><sense id="n45100.1" n="I" level="1"> Jurid. and publicists' t. t. </sense><sense id="n45100.2" n="A" level="2"> In bargains, covenants, treaties, etc., <hi rend="ital">to promise solemnly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pledge one's self</hi> (class.; syn.: recipio, stipulor, promitto; cf.: vadimonium obire, vadari); according to the civil law in its original form, it was essential to a binding contract verbally made (verbis) that a proposition and its acceptance should be expressed by the question spondes? and the answer spondeo; and only at a later period was the use of promitto, etc., valid (v. Sandars, Introd. ad Just. Inst. p. LV): verbis obligatio fit ex interrogatione et responsione, velut, Dari spondes? Spondeo. Dabis? Dabo. Promittis? Promitto; <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec quidem verborum obligatio: dari spondes? spondeo, propria civium Romanorum est, cetera vero juris gentium sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:91 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 91 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:126" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:133" default="NO">45, 1, 133</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the whole title,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1</bibl></cit>: De verborum obligationibus: <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Aeternum tibi dapinabo victum, si vera autumas ... <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Sponden' tu istut? <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Spondeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 118</bibl>: qui stulte spondet, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> 18, p. 210</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis stipulatus est? Ubi? Quo die? Quis spopondisse me dicit? Nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliquando spondere se diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis quod spopondit, quā in re verbo se obligavit uno, si id non facit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faeneris, quod stipulanti spoponderam tibi, reliquam pensiunculam percipe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego meā fide spondeo futurum ut omnia invenias, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45100.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To promise</hi> for another, <hi rend="ital">to become security</hi> for a person, <hi rend="ital">to enter bail</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod multis benigne fecerit, pro multis spoponderit,</quote> <trans><tr>has become security</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen scire velim quando dicar spopondisse et pro patre anne pro filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pro Cornificio me abhinc annis XXV. spopondisse dicit Flavius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et se quisque paratum ad spondendum Icilio ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 46, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsum diceres advocasse, Cic. Fragm. Clod. et Cur. 3, 4, p. 29 B. and K.: hic sponsum vocat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsum descendam, quia promisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:39:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 39, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45100.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of promises or pledges made in behalf of a government, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non foedere pax Caudina, sed per sponsionem facta est ... Spoponderunt consules, legati, quaestores, tribuni militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod spondendo pacem servassent exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tandem si spopondissemus urbem hanc relicturum populum Romanum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea demum sponsio esset, quam populi jussu spopondissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hosti nihil spopondistis, civem neminem spondere pro vobis jussistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45100.5" n="C" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">engage in marriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betroth</hi>: qui uxorem ducturus erat ab eo unde ducenda erat, stipulabatur eam in matrimonium ductam iri; <pb n="1746" /> <cb n="SPON" /> qui daturus erat itidem spondebat. Tum quae promissa erat sponsa appellabatur, qui spoponderat ducturum, sponsus, Sulp. Dot. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Istac lege filiam tuam sponden' mihi uxorem dari? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Spondeo. <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Et ego spondeo idem hoc, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:38 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 38 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 172</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Etiam mihi despondes filiam? <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Illis legibus, Cum illā dote quam tibi dixi. <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Sponden' ergo? <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Spondeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 78</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Spondesne, miles, mi hanc uxorem? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Spondeo. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Et ego huic victum spondeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:73 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 73 sq.</bibl>: sponden tu ergo tuam gnatam uxorem mihi? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Spondeo et mille auri Philippum dotis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 34</bibl>.—Hence, of women, alicui sponsam esse, <hi rend="ital">to be betrothed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engaged</hi> to a man: <cit><quote lang="la">si volt Demipho Dare quantum ab hac accipio, quae sponsa est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis, sponsam mihi (esse)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 9</bibl></cit> (8), 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:101 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 101 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45100.6" n="D" level="2"> = sponsionem facere (v. sponsio, II.), <hi rend="ital">to lay a judicial wager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter into an agreement to pay contingent on the truth or falsity of an assertion</hi>: si hoc ita est, qui spondet mille nummūm? P. Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 11, 9.— So, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illi jacenti latera tunderentur, ut aliquando spondere se diceret,</quote> <trans><tr>should declare that he made the required wager</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit> (cf. sponsum, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> infra); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45100.7" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to promise sacredly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to warrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vow</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n45100.8" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">fut. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promitto, recipio, spondeo, C. Caesarem talem semper fore civem, qualis hodie sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (eum) inimicissimum huic conjurationi futurum esse, promittam et spondeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 41, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ipse spondeo et omnes hoc tibi tui pro me recipient, te fructum esse capturum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est qui spondeat eundum, si differtur bellum, animum postea fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si perpetua concordia sit, quis non spondere ausit, maximum hoc imperium brevi futurum esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spondebant animis id (bellum) P. Cornelium finiturum,</quote> <trans><tr>with full conviction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 38, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 59, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponde affore reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:504" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 504</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45100.9" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to warrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give assurance of</hi> an existing fact: <cit><quote lang="la">spondebo enim tibi, vel potius spondeo in meque recipio, eos esse M'. Curii mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45100.10" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of thing</hi> (and often <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus cum consulem suum reliquissent, honores et praemia spopondistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: mihi sex menses sati' sunt vitae, septimum Orco spondeo, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 22</bibl>: ea spondent, confirmant, quae, quidem mihi exploratiora essent, si remansissem, Cic <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:11:6:3" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 11, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego non modo de me tibi spondere possum, sed de te etiam mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Fam. 15:21:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac de infante (Tiberio) Scribonius mathematicus praeclara spopondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum sibi vel de viribus suis, vel de fortunā spondentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius et dites monitis spondentibus Indi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:117" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non si mihi Juppiter auctor Spondeat, hoc sperem Italiam contingere caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spondere fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium Amori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:418" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 418</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45100.11" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. or abstract subjects (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam placidum spondentia Martis Sidera presserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:217" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod prope diem futurum spondet et virtus et fortuna vestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum hominum erat, qui, quantum spes spopondisset, cuperent, ni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna de illo (Philippo) spes fuit propter ipsius ingenium, quod magnum spondebat virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">promised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betrothed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affianced; substt</hi>, </sense><sense id="n45100.12" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a betrothed man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bridegroom</hi>: virgo Sponso superba, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 305, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accede ad sponsum audacter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 227, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:26:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 26, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsus regius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of Penelope's <hi rend="ital">suitors</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45100.13" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">spon-sa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a betrothed woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bride</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio equidem, sponsam tibi esse et filium ex sponsā tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebilis sponsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit> et saep.—Prov.: suam cuique sponsam, mihi meam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">every one to his taste</hi>, Atil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45100.14" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engagement</hi>: sponsum negare, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disown one's pledge</hi>, <cb n="SPON" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsus contra sponsum rogatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 107</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n45100.15" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a judicial wager</hi> (cf. sponsio, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex sponso egit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 9, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spondeus: <entryFree id="n45101" type="greek" key="sponde_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spondēus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">spondīus</orth>; sometimes incorrectly written <orth extent="full" lang="la">spondaeus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spondei=os</foreign>, of or belonging to libations; hence, <sense id="n45101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45101.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">spondēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a vessel used in making libations</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 266, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45101.2" n="B" level="2"> (Because of its prolonged, solemn character.) <hi rend="ital">A spondee</hi> (metrical foot), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:216" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 216</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:80 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 80 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 256</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 21, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spondiacus: <entryFree id="n45102" type="main" key="spondi_a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spondīăcus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">spondă-ĭcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">spondeiako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of spondees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spondaic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 494</bibl></cit> P.: tractus, Terentian. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Metr. p. 1321</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
spondyle: <entryFree id="n45103" type="greek" key="spondy^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spondylē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sphond-</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spondu/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n45103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an insect that lives in the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and gnaws the roots of trees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 118, § 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spondylion: <entryFree id="n45104" type="greek" key="spondy^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spondylĭon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sphond-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spondu/lion</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">sfondu/lion</foreign>), <sense id="n45104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb bear's-foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear's-wort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spicknel</hi>: Heracleum sphondylium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 26, 58, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:25" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 16, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 2" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 2</bibl> and 5.</sense></entryFree>
spondylus: <entryFree id="n45105" type="greek" key="spondy^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spondylus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sphond-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spo/ndulos</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">sfo/ndulos</foreign>). <sense id="n45105.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A joint of the spine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vertebra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spondyle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 20, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:116" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 38, § 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 6, 1, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45105.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The hard white</hi> or <hi rend="ital">muscle</hi> of an oyster or other bivalve, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:154" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 54, § 154</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45105.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of muscle</hi>: Spondylus gaederopus, Linn.; Metell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 20, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 26</bibl> and 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spongia: <entryFree id="n45106" type="greek" key="spongi^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spongĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">spongĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spoggia/</foreign>. <sense id="n45106.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sponge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 45, 69, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:123" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 11, 47, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 618</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 35, 77</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 96, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:48:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 48, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:144:1" default="NO">14, 144, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 20</bibl>; id. Ira, 3, 19, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45106.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things resembling a sponge. </sense><sense id="n45106.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An open-worked coat of mail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">retiariorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 25</bibl></cit>. —In a double sense, with the signif. I.: Ajax in spongeam incubuit, Aug. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45106.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The root</hi> of some plants; <cit><quote lang="la">of asparagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:43" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mart. 9, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of mint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 47, § 159</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45106.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of porous stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pumice-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 10, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45106.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of moss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 22, § 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45106.6" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fragments of iron melted</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45107" type="main" key="Spongi^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spongĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>, perh. fictitious, in contempt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spongio: <entryFree id="n45108" type="main" key="spongi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spongĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>spongia</etym>, <sense id="n45108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wipe off with a sponge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sponge</hi> (late Lat.), perh. only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 26</bibl>, and 8, 1.</sense></entryFree>
spongiola: <entryFree id="n45109" type="main" key="spongi^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spongĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45109.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rosegall</hi>, a spongy substance growing upon the wild rose-bush, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 6, § 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45109.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The small roots</hi> of the asparagus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:44" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spongiolus: <entryFree id="n45110" type="main" key="spongi^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spongĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small fungus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mushroom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:1" default="NO">5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:3:20" default="NO">3, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spongiosus: <entryFree id="n45111" type="main" key="spongi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spongĭōsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">spongĕōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spongy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porous</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 72, § 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 21, 42, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 11, 27, § 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spongitis: <entryFree id="n45112" type="greek" key="spongi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spongītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spoggi=tis</foreign> [id.] (sponge - stone), <sense id="n45112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spongius: <entryFree id="n45113" type="main" key="spongi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spongĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spongy</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lignum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spongizo: <entryFree id="n45114" type="greek" key="spongi_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spongīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">spoggi/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n45114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wipe off with a sponge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sponge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:16" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO">8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spongos: <entryFree id="n45115" type="main" key="spongos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spongos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sponge</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 4, 696</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spons: <entryFree id="n45116" type="main" key="spons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spons</orth>, v. sponte.</entryFree>
sponsa: <entryFree id="n45117" type="main" key="sponsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. <itype>spondeo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, E.</entryFree>
sponsalicius: <entryFree id="n45118" type="main" key="sponsa_li_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsālīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sponsalia</etym>, <sense id="n45118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to betrothal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spousal</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">arrha,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">donatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sponsalis: <entryFree id="n45119" type="main" key="sponsa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>3. sponsus</etym>. <sense id="n45119.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to betrothal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">espousal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spousal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sponsal</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quo die sponsum erat, sponsalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 70</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 54, 15</bibl></cit>: largitas, Cod. Th. 3, 16, 2. —</sense><sense id="n45119.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45119.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype> (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> sponsaliorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 9, 4</bibl>; Suet. Aug. <cb n="SPON" /> 53), <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n45119.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A betrothal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">espousal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsalia dicta sunt a spondendo. Nam moris fuit veteribus stipulari et spondere sibi uxores futuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; where v. the whole section: De sponsalibus; and cf. Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (homines missi) Romam venerant factis sponsalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19</bibl> (20), 29: <cit><quote lang="la">parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decentissimum sponsaliorum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies sponsaliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 117</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n45119.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A betrothal feast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">A. d. VIII. Id. Apr. sponsalia Crassipedi praebui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45119.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A betrothal gift</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 71, 8</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n45119.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">spon-sāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bridal bed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sponsio: <entryFree id="n45120" type="main" key="sponsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spondeo</etym>, jurid. and publicists' t. t., <sense id="n45120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a solemn promise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">engagement</hi> to some performance (in bargains, covenants, treaties, etc.); <hi rend="ital">a promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guarantee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sponsion</hi> for any one (freq. and class.; cf.: pactio, foedus). </sense><sense id="n45120.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsio appellatur omnis stipulatio promissioque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti sponsio, quā obligamur deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scandilium cogis sponsionem acceptam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 60, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per inducias sponsionem faciunt, uti, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>made an agreement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non foedere pax Caudina sed per sponsionem facta est,</quote> <trans><tr>by giving surety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsione se obstringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsionem interponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc sponsio et pax repudietur ... nec populus Romanus consulum sponsionem nec nos fidem populi Romani accusemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ocriculani sponsione in amicitiam accepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 41, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 43, 5</bibl> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 26</bibl>, is spurious; v. Ritschl ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n45120.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in civil suits, <hi rend="ital">a mutual agreement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stipulation of the parties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that he who loses should pay a certain sum to him who gains the cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sort of wager at law</hi>: per sponsionem hoc modo agimus; <cit><quote lang="la">provocamus adversarium tali sponsione: si homo quo de agitur ex jure Quiritium meus est, sestertios XXV. nummos dare spondes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:93" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio Quintio fertur, ut, si id factum negaret ceteraque, quae objecisset, sponsione defenderet sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in probrum suum sponsionem factam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 46, 14</bibl></cit>; hence, sponsio (sponsionem facere) si non (ni), <hi rend="ital">a wager that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to agree to make a payment if not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sponsionem facere possent, ni adversus edictum praetoris vis facta esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:16:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsio est, ni te Apronius socium in decumis esse dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:59:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 59, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsionem milium nummūm facere cum lictore suo, ni furtis quaestum faceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 54</bibl></cit>, § 131; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet Quinctium sponsionem cum Sex. Naevio facere, si bona sua ex edicto dies XXX. possessa non essent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 8, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 21 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsione optime facere posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:16:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 16, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 19, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apronium sponsione lacessivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsione vincere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 27, 84</bibl></cit>.—Post-class., with <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sponsione quam is cum adversario, quod vir bonus esset, fecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsionem provocare, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:10" default="NO">6, 1, 10</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cleopatra sponsione revocavit, insumere se posse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45120.3" n="2" level="3"> Hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a bet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:202" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 202</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45120.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sum of money deposited according to agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stake</hi>, acc. to Varr L. L. 6, § 70 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
sponsiuncula: <entryFree id="n45121" type="hapax" key="sponsi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sponsio</etym>, <sense id="n45121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little engagement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stipulation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sponso: <entryFree id="n45122" type="main" key="sponso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sponsus</etym>, <sense id="n45122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to betroth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affiance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">espouse</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n45122.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Vel. Virg. 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45122.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sponsabo te mihi in sempiternum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Osee, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sponsor: <entryFree id="n45123" type="main" key="sponsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>spondeo</etym>, one who becomes answerable for another. <sense id="n45123.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bondsman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surety</hi> (cf.: vas; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> vadis, praes, vindex): <cit><quote lang="la">de tuo negotio, quod sponsor es pro Pompeio, si Galba consponsor tuus redierit, non desinam cum illo communicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsores et creditores L. Trebellii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 23, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsor promissorum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 2</bibl>: si Pompeius mihi testis de voluntate Caesaris et sponsor est illi de meā, id. Prov. Cons. <pb n="1747" /> <cb n="SPON" /> 18, 43; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vel testis opinionis meae vel sponsor humanitatis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem, inquis, deorum sponsorem accepisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hymenaeus) mihi conjugii sponsor et obses erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 34</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of a goddess: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsor conjugii stat Dea picta sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45123.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">a godfather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">godmother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sponsor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sponsum: <entryFree id="n45124" type="main" key="sponsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. <itype>spondeo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, C.</entryFree>
sponsus: <entryFree id="n45125" type="main" key="sponsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of spondeo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n45126" type="main" key="sponsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. <itype>spondeo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, A.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45127" type="main" key="sponsus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>spondeo</etym>, <sense id="n45127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an engagement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betrothal; bail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suretyship</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod sponsu erat alligatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=71 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 71 sq.</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">de sponsu si quid perspexeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere cum aliquo ex sponsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 1</bibl></cit>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsu locare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Furia de sponsu adversus eum, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:22" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spontalis: <entryFree id="n45128" type="main" key="sponta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spontālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sponte</etym>, <sense id="n45128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">voluntary</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">parricidium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sobrietas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 272, 30.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spontālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">voluntarily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere (opp. coactus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spontanee: <entryFree id="n45129" type="main" key="sponta_ne^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spontānĕē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. spontaneus <sense id="n45129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
spontaneus: <entryFree id="n45130" type="main" key="sponta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spontānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sponte</etym>, <sense id="n45130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one's free will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spontaneous</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas,</quote> <trans><tr>free will</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benignitates numinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 114</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spontānĕē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">voluntarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one's own mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparere tumores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 5, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52</bibl>, n. 7.</sense></entryFree>
sponte: <entryFree id="n45131" type="main" key="sponte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sponte</orth>, <case>abl.</case>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">spontis</orth>, <sense id="n45131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (perh. the only cases in use of a noun spons, assumed by <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 34</bibl> P., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 8, 11</bibl>, as <case>nom.</case> But ad spontem is Müller's reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7:72" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7, 72</bibl>, for a sponte), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spondeo; prop. a pledging of one's self to a thing; hence, opp. to external necessity or inducement, of free will, of one's own accord</etym>. </sense><sense id="n45131.1" n="I" level="1"> Sponte, in good prose always joined with meā, tuā, suā (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">of free will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one's own accord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spontaneously</hi> (syn. ultro): <cit><quote lang="la">sponte valet a voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=69" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 69</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">si imprudenter aut necessitate aut casu quippiam fecerit, quod non concederetur iis, qui suā sponte et voluntate fecissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:37:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 37, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuo judicio et tuā sponte facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliam totam hortatur ad bellum, ipsam suā sponte suoque judicio excitatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potius consuefacere filium, Suā sponte recte facere quam alieno metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hic non insanit satis suā sponte, instiga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut id suā sponte facerent, quod cogerentur facere legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meā sponte (opp. invitatu tuo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meā sponte (opp. monente et denuntiante te),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum a me provocatus, sed etiam suā sponte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transisse Rhenum sese non suā sponte, sed rogatum et arcessitum a Gallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et suā sponte multi in disciplinam conveniunt et a parentibus propinquisque mittuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive ipse sponte suā, sive senatusconsulto accitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesitum est, praecipitata esset ab eo uxor, an se ipsa suā sponte jecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudeo id te mihi suadere, quod ego meā sponte pridie feceram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 27</bibl></cit>: sponte ipsam suāpte adductam, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=69" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 69</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">me si fata meis paterentur ducere vitam Auspiciis et sponte meā componere curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim sponte nostrā velut donantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes propriā for suā (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sponte se propriā dederunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Richomeres se sponte obtulit propriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 12, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45131.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam non sponte sequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte properant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio tyrannidis exsul Sponte erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte en ultroque peremptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:809" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 809</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo sponte et ultro confluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illum sponte exstinctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte judicioque plaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opto ut ea potissimum jubear, quae me deceat vel sponte fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: equites Romani natalem ejus sponte atque consensu biduo semper celebrarunt,<cb n="SPOR" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45131.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte deūm,</quote> <trans><tr>according to the will of the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 234</bibl></cit> Cort.: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte ducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:358" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 358</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, prooem. 1, § 4; 9, 51, 74, § 160; 11, 49, 110, § 263; 14, 4, 6, § 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:153" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incolarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litigatoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 42</bibl></cit>; 7, 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45131.4" n="(d)" level="5"> Very rarely with a <pos>prep.</pos>: de tuā sponte, Cotta ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">a sponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=69" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 69</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. § 71 sqq. ib.—</sense><sense id="n45131.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of one's own will or agency (opp. to foreign participation or assistance), <hi rend="ital">by one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without the aid of others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alone</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nequeo Pedibus meā sponte ambulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec suā sponte, sed eorum auxilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum oppidani autem etiam suā sponte Caesarem recipere conarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his cum suā sponte persuadere non possent, legatos ad Dumnorigem mittunt, ut eo deprecatore a Sequanis impetrarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem ignobilem atque humilem Eburonum suā sponte populo Romano bellum facere ausam, vix erat credendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium quod Verres suā sponte instituisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:43:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 43, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illa civitas cum Poenis suo nomine ac suā sponte bellaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 33</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">72: ecquis Volcatio si suā sponte venisset, unam libellam dedisset?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>, § 26.—</sense><sense id="n45131.6" n="2" level="3"> Of things concr. and abstr., <hi rend="ital">of itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spontaneously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is autem ardor non alieno impulsu sed suā sponte movetur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:12:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum suā sponte nullā adhibitā vi, consumptus ignis exstinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura videtur Ipsa suā per se sponte omnia dis agere expers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1092" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1092</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae (arbores) nullis hominum cogentibus ipsae Sponte suā veniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae sponte suā jussaene vagentur et errent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientem suā sponte ac per se bonitas et justitia delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:16:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 16, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res quae suā sponte scelerata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:42:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 42, § 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitium in foro suā sponte coeptum prius quam indictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor suā sponte ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 41, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id suā sponte ap parebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 38, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de capite signum in manum sponte suā delapsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 11, 3</bibl></cit> ex loco superiore, qui prope suā sponte in hostem inferebat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 43, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod terra crearat Sponte suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:938" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 938</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte suā quae fiunt aëre in ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 738</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vera et falsa suā sponte, non alienā judicantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te Sponte suā probitas officiumque juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte deae munus promeritumque patet (i. e. sine indice),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:394" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 394</bibl></cit>.—Very rarely with <hi rend="ital">quādam</hi>: litterae syllabaeque ... orationem sponte quādam sequantur, Quint 5, 10, 125. —</sense><sense id="n45131.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut numeri sponte fluxisse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:147" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 147</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45131.8" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">spontis</orth>, <itype>only in the phrase suae spontis</itype> (esse). </sense><sense id="n45131.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be one's own master</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at one's own disposal</hi> (very rare and mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): quod suae spontis statuerant finem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=71" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 71</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanus homo, qui suae spontis est, nullis obligare se legibus debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45131.10" n="B" level="2"> In Columella, of things, = suā sponte, <hi rend="ital">of itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spontaneously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera (cytisus est) suae spontis,</quote> <trans><tr>springs up spontaneously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi loci natura neque manu illatam neque suae spontis aquam ministrari patitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spontis: <entryFree id="n45132" type="main" key="spontis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spontis</orth>, v. sponte, II.</entryFree>
sporades: <entryFree id="n45133" type="main" key="Spo^ra^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spŏrădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*spora/des</foreign>, <sense id="n45133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">islands in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Cyclades and Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 63</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Sporadas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 550</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sporta: <entryFree id="n45134" type="main" key="sporta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sporta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">spuri/s</foreign>, basket <foreign lang="greek">spa/rton, spei=ra</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n45134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plaited basket</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ham per</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 4</bibl>; Varr. and Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 177, 22 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:6:1" default="NO">12, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45134.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sieve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 17, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:37:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 37, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 15, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 440, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sportella: <entryFree id="n45135" type="main" key="sportella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sportella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sporta</etym>, <sense id="n45135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little basket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fruit-basket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 40, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sportula: <entryFree id="n45136" type="main" key="sportu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sportŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45136.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a little basket</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sportulam cape atque argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 1, 8</bibl>.—In such little <cb n="SPUM" /> baskets it was customary for a great man to distribute presents of food or money to the mass of his clients, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:249" default="NO">3, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:14:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:125:2" default="NO">14, 125, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:27:3" default="NO">10, 27, 3</bibl>.—Hence, the emperor Claudius called the brief games which he gave to the people sportulae, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: sportulam furunculus captat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>snatches at others' little property</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45136.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a gift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:10:118" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 10, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:117" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:2:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 21, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sportulo: <entryFree id="n45137" type="main" key="sportu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sportŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n45137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take the dole of a patron</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sporus: <entryFree id="n45138" type="main" key="Spo^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a eunuch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a favorite of Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
spretio: <entryFree id="n45139" type="hapax" key="spre_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sprētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sperno</etym>, <sense id="n45139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contempt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 5</bibl></cit> dub.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Enarr. in Psa. 43, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spretor: <entryFree id="n45140" type="main" key="spre_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sprētor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despiser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemner</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronalium amplexuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 137, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spretus: <entryFree id="n45141" type="main" key="spre_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sprētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sperno.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45142" type="main" key="spre_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sprētus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sperno</etym>, <sense id="n45142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contempt</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">insolentissimo spretu deos neglegit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spretui maximc est judiciis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
spuma: <entryFree id="n45143" type="main" key="spu_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spuo</etym>. <sense id="n45143.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">foam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">froth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spume</hi> from the mouth; of the sea; in boiling, etc. (class.; used alike in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): spiritus (equi) ex animā calidā spumas agit albas, <hi rend="ital">foams</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 507 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">vi morbi coactus Concidit et spumas agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 489</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum spumas ageret in ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per armos Spuma (apri) fluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:288" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus altera spuma procreata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 538</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumas salis aere ruebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac spumis stridentibus albet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 417</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 263</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 48, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 37, § 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of men,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 793</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45143.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">silver-spume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">litharge of silver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:102 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 34, § 102 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:176" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 18, 54, § 176</bibl>: spuma caustica, <hi rend="ital">a pomade</hi> used by the Teutones for dyeing the hair red, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:26" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also spuma Batava,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 33, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spumabundus: <entryFree id="n45144" type="hapax" key="spu_ma_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūmābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spumo</etym>, <sense id="n45144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frothing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 303, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spumatio: <entryFree id="n45145" type="main" key="spu_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foaming</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
