spumatus: <entryFree id="n45146" type="hapax" key="spu_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">froth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis abundat spumatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:103" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spumesco: <entryFree id="n45147" type="hapax" key="spu_mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūmesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n45147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [spuma], <hi rend="ital">to grow foamy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frothy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to foam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">froth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora remo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spumeus: <entryFree id="n45148" type="main" key="spu_me^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūmĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frothy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Nereus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:221:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 221, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulus undarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies per ora effluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 190</bibl></cit>; cf.: salivae hominis, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 101: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 33, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen heraclii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 19, 79, § 207</bibl></cit>: color equorum, <hi rend="ital">foamlike</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dappled</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 13, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spumidus: <entryFree id="n45149" type="main" key="spu_mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūmĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frothy</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">umor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 306.</sense></entryFree>
spumifer: <entryFree id="n45150" type="main" key="spu_mi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūmĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spuma-fero</etym>, <sense id="n45150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foam-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foaming</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spumigena: <entryFree id="n45151" type="hapax" key="spu_mi^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūmĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spuma-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n45151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foam-born</hi>, an epithet of Venus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 915</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spumiger: <entryFree id="n45152" type="main" key="spu_mi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūmĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spumagero</etym>, <sense id="n45152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making foam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foaming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:985" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 985</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spumo: <entryFree id="n45153" type="main" key="spu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n45153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [spuma]. </sense><sense id="n45153.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">froth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): caeruleum spumat sale, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26</bibl> (Ann. v. 378 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">maria salsa spumant sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Non. 183:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Non. 183, 19</bibl></cit> (Trag. v. 145 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">fluctu spumabant caerula cano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adductis spumant freta versa lacertis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 141</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 493</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumans aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 243</bibl>: Amasenus spumabat,<pb n="1748" /> <cb n="SPUR" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 548</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus spumat habenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula bina novo spumantia lacte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 739</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spumat plenis vindemia labris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumans bilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 25, § 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra respersa aceto spumat,</quote> <trans><tr>foams up</tr>, <tr>boils up</tr>, <tr>effervesces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena spumantia,</quote> <trans><tr>covered with foam</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 817</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 456</bibl></cit>.—Of an angry person: <cit><quote lang="la">spumantibus ardens visceribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45153.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to foam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foam forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover with foam</hi> (very rare). * </sense><sense id="n45153.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: saxa salis niveo spumata liquore, Cic. Poët. Div. 1, 7, 13.—</sense><sense id="n45153.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ore scelus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 55, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 282</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spumosus: <entryFree id="n45154" type="main" key="spu_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spuma</etym>. <sense id="n45154.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full of foam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foaming</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumosus nec sanguineus (pulmo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 72, § 188</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Addua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 458</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45154.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>frothy</tr>, <tr>bombastic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:96" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spuo: <entryFree id="n45155" type="main" key="spu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŭo</orth>, <itype>ui, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n45155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. shtiv.; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ptu/w</foreign>; Germ. speien; Engl. spit], <hi rend="ital">to spit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spit out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spew</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n45155.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antoniam Drusi non spuisse percelebre est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex toto spuere desisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in faciem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 12, 14</bibl></cit>.—Esp., as a charm against fascination, etc. (cf. conspuo, I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">veniam a deis petimus spuendo in sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sputatur morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit> sqq. Brix ad loc.; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:112" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 112</bibl> Mayor ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n45155.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicco terram (i. e. pulverem) spuit ore viator Aridus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 97</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">spūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (acc. to II.). </sense><sense id="n45155.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">spit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spittle; sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 38</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 66; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:26:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45155.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">a light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin plate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spurcalia: <entryFree id="n45156" type="main" key="spurca_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spurcālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [spurco], <sense id="n45156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pollutions</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aldh.</author> Laud. Virg. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spurcamen: <entryFree id="n45157" type="hapax" key="spurca_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spurcāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spurce: <entryFree id="n45158" type="main" key="spurce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spurcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. spurcus <sense id="n45158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
spurcidicus: <entryFree id="n45159" type="hapax" key="spurci^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spurcĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spurcusdico</etym>, <sense id="n45159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">using filthy language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smutty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spurcificus: <entryFree id="n45160" type="hapax" key="spurci^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spurcĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spurcusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n45160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smutty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spurciloquium: <entryFree id="n45161" type="hapax" key="spurci^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spurcĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>spurcus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n45161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filthy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">smutty language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscenity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
spurcitia: <entryFree id="n45162" type="main" key="spurci^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spurcĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>nom.</case> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">spur-cĭtĭes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:977" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 977</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> spurcitie, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214, 33</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spurcus</etym>, <sense id="n45162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dung</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n45162.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:17:2" default="NO">12, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 69</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spurcitias suum laudant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45162.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: alicujus, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 393, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 394, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spurco: <entryFree id="n45163" type="main" key="spurco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spurco</orth>, no <sense id="n45163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to befoul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi> (rare; syn.: polluo, contamino). </sense><sense id="n45163.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis fimo aliquem pertuderit, luto oblinierit, aquā spurcaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex istoc loco spurcatur nasum odore inlutili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45163.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus Spurcata impuris moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:108:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 108, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spurcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">helluo spurcatissimus,</quote> <trans><tr>most foul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 10, 25</bibl></cit> B. and K.</sense></entryFree>
spurcus: <entryFree id="n45164" type="main" key="spurcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spurcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. spargo</etym>, <sense id="n45164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unclean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impure</hi> (class.; syn.: immundus, impurus, obscenus). </sense><sense id="n45164.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 782</bibl></cit>; cf.: rem spurcissimam gustare, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 394, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeque aspectu sunt spurca et odore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 394:25" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 394, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:78:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 78, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:99:10" default="NO" valid="yes">99, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">25: spurcum atque pollutum vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:19:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid est urinā spurcius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:19:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: tempestas spurcissima, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 394, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spurcatissimis tempestatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spurcum vinum est, quod sacris adhiberi non licet, ut ait Labeo Antistius, cui aqua admixta est defrutumve aut igne tactum est, mustumve antequam defervescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=348" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 348</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 3</bibl>.—Of obscene defilement: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lupae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:35:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 35, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45164.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <cb n="SQUA" /> of character or condition, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>: Samnis, spurcus homo, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl>: lictor, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 394</bibl> 5: <cit><quote lang="la">Dama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVAESTVS, i. e. lenocinium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1773, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est te spurcius uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:56:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 56, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita taeterrima et spurcissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo avarissime et spurcissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:37:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 37, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo spurcissimae vitae ac defamatissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeferendam esse spurcissimam mortem servituti mundissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 21</bibl></cit>: spurca ingenii vestigia, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 393, 27</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spurcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">dirtily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impurely.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45164.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus in pabulatione spurce versatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45164.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">basely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">villanously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spurce factum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in illam miseram tam spurce, tam impie dixeris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hast charged her with unchastity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Comp.</hi>: spurcius nos quam alios opicos appellatione foedant, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 7, § 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perscribere spurcissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spurinna: <entryFree id="n45165" type="main" key="Spu_rinna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spūrinna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Etruscan</etym>, <sense id="n45165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the surname of several Romans.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45165.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The haruspex who warned Cœsar to beware of the Ides of March</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 52, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:11:2" default="NO">8, 11, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45165.2" n="II" level="1"> Vestricius Spurinna, <hi rend="ital">a lyric poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the leader of the Othonian party</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spurium: <entryFree id="n45166" type="main" key="spu^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŭrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">spora/</foreign>, generation</etym>. <sense id="n45166.0" n="I" level="1"> = pudendum muliebre, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 5, 24</bibl>; cf. Plut. Quaest. Rom. 103.—</sense><sense id="n45166.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a marine animal of a similar shape</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 297, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spurius: <entryFree id="n45167" type="main" key="spu^ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŭrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root spar-; cf. <foreign lang="greek">spei/rw, spora/</foreign>, and sperno</etym>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n45167.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of illegitimate birth; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an illegitimate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spurious child</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bastard</hi> (only post-class.; esp. among jurists): si quis nefarias atque incestas nuptias contraxerit, neque uxorem habere videtur neque liberos. Hi enim, qui ex eo coitu nascuntur, matrem quidem habere videntur, patrem vero non utique, etc. ... Unde solent spurii filii appeliari, vel a Graecā voce, quasi <foreign lang="greek">spora/dhn</foreign> concepti vel quasi sine patre filii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:64" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 64</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:15:26" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 15, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 55, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177, 6</bibl>.—Thus the Parthenians (v. Partheniae) were also called Spurii, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 1, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45167.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus (in Homeri carminibus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: vates, id. ap. Sept. Sap. 13 prooem.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45168" type="main" key="Spu^ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spŭrĭus</orth> (abbrev. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sp</orth>.), <sense id="n45168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman prœnomen;</hi> e. g. Spurius Cassius, Spurius Maelius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:27:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 27, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sputamen: <entryFree id="n45169" type="main" key="spu_ta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūtāmen</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sputo</etym>, <sense id="n45169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spittle</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 744</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 10</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:199" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sputamentum: <entryFree id="n45170" type="main" key="spu_ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spittle</hi> (late Lat.), Jul. Val Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sputatilicus: <entryFree id="n45171" type="main" key="spu_ta_ti^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūtātĭlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that deserves to be spit at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detestable</hi> (a word coined by Sisenna): crimina ejus, Sisenn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:260" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 260</bibl> (= <foreign lang="greek">kata/ptusta</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
sputator: <entryFree id="n45172" type="hapax" key="spu_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who spits much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spitter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sputo: <entryFree id="n45173" type="main" key="spu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>spuo</etym>, <sense id="n45173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spit out</hi> (mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: morbus, qui sputatur, <hi rend="ital">that disease before which one spits</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the epilepsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 18</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">mixtos sputantem sanguine dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 256</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sputum: <entryFree id="n45174" type="main" key="spu_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. spuo <sense id="n45174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sputus: <entryFree id="n45175" type="main" key="spu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spūtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>spuo</etym>, <sense id="n45175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spitting</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:4:80" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 4, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:2:18" default="NO">3, 2, 18</bibl>; Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 18</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 23.</sense></entryFree>
squalefacio: <entryFree id="n45176" type="main" key="squa_le^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squālĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>squalidusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n45176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make squalid</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrysol. Serm. 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
squalentia: <entryFree id="n45177" type="main" key="squa_lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squālentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>squaleo</etym>, <sense id="n45177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exh. ad Cast. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
squaleo: <entryFree id="n45178" type="main" key="squa_le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squālĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>squalor</etym>, <sense id="n45178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be stiff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rough</hi> with any thing, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. sordeo). </sense><sense id="n45178.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45178.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">squalentes infode conchas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tunicam squalentem auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 314</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auro squalens lorica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculis auro squalentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:585" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 585</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">picti squalentia terga lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: squalentia<cb n="SQUA" />  tela venenis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:397" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 397</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45178.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45178.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be stiff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rough</hi> from dryness or drought, <hi rend="ital">to be dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalebant pulvere fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraque projecta squalent arentia linguā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus squalet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:592" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 592</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45178.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Of lands, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be desert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalentes campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:655" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 655</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:376" default="NO">4, 376</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalens litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalentia arva Libyes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 205</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilis profundi vastitas squalet soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 697" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 697</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45178.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be stiff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rough</hi> from slovenliness or want of care; <hi rend="ital">to be filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squalid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalenti Dido comā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:640" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalens barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines squalent a pulvere effuso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:452" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba cruore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:512" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes squalentes atro pulvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego arma squalere situ ac rubigine velim, sed fulgorem inesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi supellex squalet atque aedes meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae nigro squalentia tabo Tecta petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 760</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:627" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 627</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalent abductis arva colonis,</quote> <trans><tr>lie untilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 507</bibl></cit>; cf. 1. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, supra.—</sense><sense id="n45178.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to mourn in filthy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">squalid garments</hi> (cf. sordes and sordidatus; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. only so): erat in luctu senatus: squalebat civitas publico consilio mutatā veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luget senatus, maeret equester ordo, tota civitas confecta senio est, squalent municipia, afflictantur coloniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 8, 20</bibl></cit>. —<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">squālĕntĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">deserts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
squales: <entryFree id="n45179" type="main" key="squa_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squāles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>squaleo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n45179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>: ager periret squale, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">125, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">168, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">squale scabieque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:ib. 152:29" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> ib. 152, 29</bibl></cit> (Trag. Rel. v. 314 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
squalide: <entryFree id="n45180" type="main" key="squa_li^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squālĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. squalidus <sense id="n45180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
squaliditas: <entryFree id="n45181" type="main" key="squa_li^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squālĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>squalidus</etym>, <sense id="n45181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squalidity;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">neglect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorder</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia confundentes squaliditate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
squalidus: <entryFree id="n45182" type="main" key="squa_li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squālĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>squaleo</etym>. <sense id="n45182.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to squaleo, I.) In gen., <hi rend="ital">stiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:956" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 956</bibl></cit>: serpentis squamae squalido auro et purpurā praetextae, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 23</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 452, 28</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 517 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n45182.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to squaleo, II.) In partic. </sense><sense id="n45182.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Stiff</hi> with dirt, <hi rend="ital">dirty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squalid</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): stola, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 537, 26</bibl> (Trag. v. 373 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo horridus et squalidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:41 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 41 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalida et prope efferata corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:127" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 883" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 883</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalida siccitate regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubigo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:558" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispania,</quote> <trans><tr>uncultivated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 77, § 203</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., of persons in mourning: reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 60</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45182.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nocte squalidā et interluni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalidi Solis exortus hebetabant matutinos diei candores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45182.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45182.5" n="1" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadorned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suā sponte (haec) squalidiora sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 32, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45182.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Wretched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incurable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiam omnem squalidā diversitate confundere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">squālĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalidius dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
squalitas: <entryFree id="n45183" type="main" key="squa_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, Att. and Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 4 sq.</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. Fragm. v. 617" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. Fragm. v. 617</bibl> Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
squalitudo: <entryFree id="n45184" type="hapax" key="squa_li^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squālĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>squalidus</etym>, <sense id="n45184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 2</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 340 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
squalor: <entryFree id="n45185" type="main" key="squa_lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squālor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. kālas, black; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kelaino/s, khli/s</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n45185.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">stiffness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque (res) aspera constat, Non aliquo sine materiae squalore reperta est (opp. lēvor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 425</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45185.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">stiffness</hi> from dirt, <hi rend="ital">dirtiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squalor</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; syn.: sordes, illuvies). </sense><sense id="n45185.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45185.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">immundas fortunas aequum est squalorem sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squaloris plenus ac pulveris (opp. unguentis oblitus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:12:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsita erat squalore vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuvie, squalore enecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavis et imbellibus manet squalor (corresp. to crinem barbamque submittere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex macie et squalore confectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis squalore deciso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1749" /> <cb n="SQUA" /> 14, 39, § <cit><quote lang="la">138: squalore situque posito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:43" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45185.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of places: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum squalor et solitudines inviae militem terrebant,</quote> <trans><tr>desolation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">silva squalore tenebrarum horrenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45185.5" n="3" level="3"> So esp. freq. of <hi rend="ital">filthy garments</hi>, as a sign of mourning: <cit><quote lang="la">decesserat ex Asiā frater meus magno squalore, sed multo majore maerore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 31, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicite, judices, squalorem sordesque sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:48:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 48, § 128</bibl></cit>; so (with sordes and luctus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">67, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 40, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 10, 2</bibl>; Metell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 33</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with maestitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45185.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deterso rudis saeculi squalore,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in language</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallus, ex squalore nimio miseriarum, ad principale culmen provectus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from the very lowest rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
squalus: <entryFree id="n45186" type="hapax" key="squa_lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squālus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>squales</etym>, <sense id="n45186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squalid</hi>, = squalidus: lavere lacrimis vestem squalam et sordidam, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 20</bibl> (Trag. v. 370 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45187" type="main" key="squa^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 9</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 24, 40, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:162" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 51, 74, § 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:123" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
squama: <entryFree id="n45188" type="main" key="squa_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squāma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scale</hi> (of a fish, serpent, etc.). </sense><sense id="n45188.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias (animantes) squamis obductas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>.—Of a serpent: <cit><quote lang="la">tractu squamae crepitantis harenam Sulcat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hydri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 545</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 754</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 577</bibl>.—Of a fish: <cit><quote lang="la">alia integuntur squamis ut pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 12, 14, § 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 295</bibl>.—Of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">rutilis clarus squamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45188.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n45188.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45188.4" n="2" level="3"> Of scaleshaped things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n45188.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Scale-armor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 707</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 488</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45188.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A cataract</hi> in the eye, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 21</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45188.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Hulls</hi> or <hi rend="ital">husks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 24, § 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45188.8" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Scales of metal struck off by the hammer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 15, 46, § 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 24, § 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 12, 33, § 107</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45188.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudeness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
squamatim: <entryFree id="n45189" type="hapax" key="squa_ma_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squāmātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>squama</etym>, <sense id="n45189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like scales</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compacta nucamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
squamatus: <entryFree id="n45190" type="hapax" key="squa_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squāmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scaly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica squamata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 17, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
squameus: <entryFree id="n45191" type="main" key="squa_me^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squāmĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scaly</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n45191.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga (anguium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrana chelydri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 272</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45191.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: clipeatus et auro Squameus, <hi rend="ital">in golden scales</hi> (of a coat of mail), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 522</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
squamifer: <entryFree id="n45192" type="main" key="squa_mi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squāmĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>squamafero</etym>, <sense id="n45192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scale - bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scaly</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">orbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba (anguium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 685" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 685</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
squamiger: <entryFree id="n45193" type="main" key="squa_mi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squāmĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>squamagero</etym>, <sense id="n45193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scale-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scaly</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=328" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 328</bibl></cit> (574): <cit><quote lang="la">cervices (anguis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 717</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">squāmĭgĕri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">fishes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:370" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 370</bibl> sq.; 2, 343; 2, 1083; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
squamosus: <entryFree id="n45194" type="main" key="squa_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squāmōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-mossus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>squama</etym>, <sense id="n45194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covered with scales</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squamous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n45194.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus (i. e. pisces),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soleamne esse avis squamossas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">draco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 408</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venter cerastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 22, 27: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes (anguis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges (piscium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: agmina, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 144: <cit><quote lang="la">belua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1048" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1048</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 263</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45194.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">thorax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 72</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <trans><tr>stiff</tr>, <tr>rough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 325</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
squamula: <entryFree id="n45195" type="main" key="squa_mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squāmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little scale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
squarrosus: <entryFree id="n45196" type="main" key="squarro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squarrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (perh. <sense id="n45196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scurfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scabby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scalled</hi>): squarrosi a squamarum similitudine dicti, quorum cutis exsurgit ob assiduam illuviem, Fest. pp. 328 and 329 Muüll.; Lucil. ap. Fest. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
squatina: <entryFree id="n45197" type="main" key="squa_ti^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squātĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kh=tos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n45197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of shark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the angel-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skate</hi>: Squalus squatina, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 12, 14, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:162" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 51, 74, § 162</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">squātus</orth>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 6, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>; and: squatus <foreign lang="greek">r(i/na, ei)=dos i)xqu/os</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. <cb n="STAB" /></sense></entryFree>
squilla: <entryFree id="n45198" type="main" key="squilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">squilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. scilla.</entryFree>
st: <entryFree id="n45199" type="main" key="st" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">st</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, <sense id="n45199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hist! whist! hush!</hi> st, tale verbum cave faxis, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 214</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">st, st, tacete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: st, tacete, quid hoc clamoris? Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 257</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">st, litteras tuas exspecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 163</bibl> sq. al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45200" type="main" key="'st" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">'st</orth>, abbrev. for est, v. sum <sense id="n45200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
staberius: <entryFree id="n45201" type="main" key="Sta^be^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăbĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Latin grammarian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 58, § 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stabiae: <entryFree id="n45202" type="main" key="Sta^bi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăbĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town on the coast of Campania near Pompeii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its medicinal springs. It was partially destroyed by Sylla during the Social War</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was finally overwhelmed at the same time with Herculaneum and Pompeii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 711</bibl>; Col. poët. 10, 133; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 12</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăbĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Stabiœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Stabian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăbĭānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n45202.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The Stabian territory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Stabiano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45202.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A villa of M. Marius near Stabiœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stabilimen: <entryFree id="n45203" type="hapax" key="sta^bi^li_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbĭlīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>stabilio</etym>, <sense id="n45203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stabiliment</hi>: regni stabilimen, Att. ap. Cic. poët. N. D. 3, 26, 68 (Fragm. Trag. v. 210 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
stabilimentum: <entryFree id="n45204" type="main" key="sta^bi^li_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbĭlīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stabiliment</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n45204.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt ventris stabilimenta, pane et assa bubula, Poclum grande,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 7, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n45204.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicilia et Sardinia stabilimenta bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
stabilio: <entryFree id="n45205" type="main" key="sta^bi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum</itype> (sync. <sense id="n45205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> stabilibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:44" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 44</bibl>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>stabilis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfast</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">stable; to fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish</hi> (class.; esp. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n45205.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: semita nulla pedem stabilibat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 44 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">eo stabilita magis sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 202</bibl></cit>; cf.: confirmandi et stabiliendi causā singuli ab infimo solo pedes terrā exculcabantur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loligini pedes duo, quibus se velut ancoris stabiliunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 28, 44, § 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45205.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: regni stabilita scamna solumque, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (Ann. v. 99 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui regnum suom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: libertatem civibus, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 58, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam (opp. evertere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 65</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:68:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 68, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi haec urbs stabilita tuis consiliis erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonia firmiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: pacem, concordiam, Pseud.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Rep. Ordin. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Rep. Ordin. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (p. 267 Gerl.): <cit><quote lang="la">res Capuae stabilitas Romana disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen equestre in consulatu (Cicero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 8, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aegrum) ad retinendam patientiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to strengthen</tr>, <tr>fortify him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stabilis: <entryFree id="n45206" type="main" key="sta^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sto, prop. where one can stand; hence, pregn.</etym>, <sense id="n45206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that stands firm; firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steady</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stable</hi> (class.; esp. in the trop. sense; syn.: firmus, constans). </sense><sense id="n45206.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">via plana et stabilis (opp. praeceps et lubrica),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 42, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus ad insistendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio sedet insula ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:303" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per stabilem ratem tamquam viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti pondere ipso stabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 28, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabilior Romanus erat,</quote> <trans><tr>was more firm</tr>, <tr>stood his ground better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 35, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stabili gradu impetum hostium excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 12, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 35</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani stabili pugnae assueti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae domus tam stabilis, quae tam firma civitas est, quae? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabilis pulsus,</quote> <trans><tr>a steady pulse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 89, § 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venae aquarum,</quote> <trans><tr>steadily flowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 3, 28, § 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45206.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stable; immutable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwavering; steadfast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrepid</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">firmus, constans, certus): fundamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici firmi et stabiles et constantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabilem se in amicitiā praestare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabile et fixum et permanens bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretum stabile, fixum, ratum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabilis certaque sententia (opp. errans et vaga),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: urbs sedem <cb n="STAB" /> stabilem non habebit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 9, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium stabile et certum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabilis et certa possessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta firma, stabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N.
