D. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio stabilis ac non mutata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam ad diuturnitatem memoriae stabile quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus stabilis amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus, Quae maneat stabili cum fugit illa (Fortuna) pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 30</bibl></cit>.—Of springs: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae certae, stabilesque et salubres,</quote> <trans><tr>unfailing</tr>, <tr>perennial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 28, § 48</bibl></cit>: eam (summam voluptatem) tum adesse, cum dolor omnis absit: eam stabilem appellas (opp. in motu), i. e. <hi rend="ital">a fixed state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 75</bibl>.—Of feet, syllables, etc., in verse: <cit><quote lang="la">spondei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 256</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pedes, dochmius, syllabae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:97 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 97 sq.</bibl></cit>: stabilia probant, i. e. <hi rend="ital">consisting of such feet</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 116</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium stabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: quaestus stabilissimus, Cato, R. R. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—* </sense><sense id="n45206.3" n="b" level="4"> Stabile est, with <hi rend="ital">subject - clause</hi>, like certum est, <hi rend="ital">it is settled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is decided</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto stabile'st, me patri aurum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbĭlĭter</orth> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permanently</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">includatur tympanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundare molem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stabilitas: <entryFree id="n45207" type="main" key="sta^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stabilis</etym>, <sense id="n45207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing fast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfastness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immovability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stability</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n45207.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ita mobilitatem equitum, stabilitatem peditum in proeliis praestant, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpes stabilitatem dant iis, quae sustinent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 3, 37, § 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45207.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui poterit aut corporis firmitate aut fortunae stabilitate confidere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiam non stabilitate et constantiā judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 47</bibl></cit>; so (with constantia) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabilitas amicitiae confirmari potest, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae sunt sententiae, quae stabilitatis aliquid habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stabiliter: <entryFree id="n45208" type="main" key="sta^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. stabilis <sense id="n45208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stabilitor: <entryFree id="n45209" type="main" key="sta^bi^li_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbĭlītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stabilio</etym>, <sense id="n45209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an establisher</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus, quod stant beneficio ejus omnia, stator stabilitorque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stabularius: <entryFree id="n45210" type="main" key="sta^bu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stabulum</etym>, <sense id="n45210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a stopping-place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stable</hi> (post - Aug.): stabularia mulier, <hi rend="ital">a hostess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">landlady</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 18.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> * </sense><sense id="n45210.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A stable - boy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45210.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A host</hi>, <hi rend="ital">landlord</hi> of the lowest kind of inn; <hi rend="ital">a tavern-keeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stable-keeper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:5:1" default="NO">47, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 110, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 10, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stabulatio: <entryFree id="n45211" type="hapax" key="sta^bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stabulor</etym>, <sense id="n45211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where cattle stand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">are housed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stabulo: <entryFree id="n45212" type="main" key="sta^bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. stabulor, I. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, and II.</entryFree>
stabulor: <entryFree id="n45213" type="main" key="sta^bu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n45213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbŭlo</orth>, āre; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>) [stabulum] (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n45213.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have an abode</hi> anywhere; <hi rend="ital">to stable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kennel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harbor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roost</hi>, etc. (mostly of animals). </sense><sense id="n45213.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">aviaria, in quibus stabulentur turdi ac pavones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos sicce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes multae in antris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces in petris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens in illis locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut permittat jumenta apud eum stabulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: Tartessos stabulanti conscia Phoebo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">setting</hi> (qs. returning to his lodging-place), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:399" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 399</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45213.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">centauri in foribus stabulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una stabulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus sub Haemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:275" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter stabulare bimembres Centauros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 457</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45213.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">house cattle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alienum pecus in suo fundo pascat ac stabulet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stabulum: <entryFree id="n45214" type="main" key="sta^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwelling.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45214.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. passages): stabile stabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam stabulum est confidentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DOMESTICORVM ET STABVLI SACRI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45214.2" n="II" level="1"> A stoppingplace or abode for animals or persons of the lower class (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n45214.3" n="A" level="2"> For animals, <hi rend="ital">a stall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosure</hi> of any kind (cf. praesepe): <cit><quote lang="la">ovium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1750" /> <cb n="STAG" /> 19: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudum, boum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:23:2" default="NO">6, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 295</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 302</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 3 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pastorum stabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium cohortalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavonum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an aviary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a fishpond</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 17</bibl></cit> 7: <cit><quote lang="la">apium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a beehive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabula ferarum,</quote> <trans><tr>lairs</tr>, <tr>haunts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 179</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 723</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a stabulis tauros avertit,</quote> <trans><tr>pasture</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 207</bibl></cit>; 8, 213.—</sense><sense id="n45214.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">herds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flocks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">droves</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">stabuli nutritor Iberi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Spanish sheep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansueta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45214.5" n="B" level="2"> Of humble houses. </sense><sense id="n45214.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A dwelling like a stable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cottage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardua tecta stabuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 512</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45214.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a public-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pothouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tavern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostelry</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cauponam vel stabulum exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 4</bibl>; 79, 5; 97, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:94:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 94, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 1 al.</bibl>—Such pothouses were also the usual abode of prostitutes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 56</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45214.8" n="3" level="3"> Stabulum = lupanar, <hi rend="ital">a brothel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">house of ill - fame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro cubiculis stabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45214.9" n="4" level="3"> As a term of abuse: <cit><quote lang="la">stabulum flagitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitritium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—On account of his intercourse with king Nicomedes, the nickname of stabulum Nicomedis was given to Cæsar, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stachys: <entryFree id="n45215" type="greek" key="sta^chys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăchys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sta/xus</foreign>, <sense id="n45215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horsemint</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 86, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stacta: <entryFree id="n45216" type="greek" key="stacta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stacta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">stactē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stakth/</foreign>, <sense id="n45216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">myrrh-oil.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45216.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Stacta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:847" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 847</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 15, 35, § 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45216.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Stacte, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 17</bibl>.—Also, myrrha stacta (stacte), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 125" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:145" default="NO">145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 15, 35, § 68</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 173.</sense></entryFree>
stacton: <entryFree id="n45217" type="greek" key="stacton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stacton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stakto/n</foreign>, <sense id="n45217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eye-salve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 34" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stacula: <entryFree id="n45218" type="main" key="stacu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stacŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> sircula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 34</bibl> (Jahn, scapula).</sense></entryFree>
stadia: <entryFree id="n45219" type="main" key="Stadia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stadia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient name of the town of Cnidus in Caria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stadialis: <entryFree id="n45220" type="hapax" key="sta^di^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stădĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stadium</etym>, <sense id="n45220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing a</hi> stadium: ager, Auct. Grom. ap. Goes. p. 321.</sense></entryFree>
stadiatus: <entryFree id="n45221" type="hapax" key="sta^di^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stădĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with a race-course</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
stadiodromos: <entryFree id="n45222" type="greek" key="sta^di^o^dro^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stădĭŏdrŏmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stadio/dromos</foreign>, <sense id="n45222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a runner in a foot-race</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 8.—<hi rend="ital">A statue of Astylon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stadios: <entryFree id="n45223" type="main" key="Stadi^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stadĭos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 42, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stadisis: <entryFree id="n45224" type="main" key="Stadisis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stadisis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stadium: <entryFree id="n45225" type="greek" key="sta^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stădĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n45225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form, <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> stadios, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 15</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.; gen. plur.</hi> usu. stadium; <cit><quote lang="la">but stadiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 247</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 24, § 75</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">sta/dion</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n45225.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a stade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stadium</hi>, a distance of 125 paces, or 625 Roman feet, equal to 606 feet 9 inches English; <cit><quote lang="la">it was an eighth part of a milliarium, or somewhat less than an eighth of an English mile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 2</bibl>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 496, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 21, 19, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 108, 112, § 247</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45225.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a racecourse</hi> for foot - racing, of a stadium in length (among the Greeks): <cit><quote lang="la">qui stadium currit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in stadio cursores exclamant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45225.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a contest</hi>, = contentio (perh. only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">in stadium artis rhetoricae prodire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stadio laudis versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:2, p. 77" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> 2, p. 77</bibl></cit> (p. 139 Frotscher; but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:230" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 64, 230</bibl>, the correct read. is in studio laudis).</sense></entryFree>
stadius: <entryFree id="n45226" type="main" key="Stadius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stadius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:65" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stagira: <entryFree id="n45227" type="main" key="Sta^gi_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăgīra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sta/geira</foreign>, <sense id="n45227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Aristotle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 4, 8</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăgīrītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stageiri/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Stagirite</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Aristotle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl>; also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăgērītes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stagnatilis: <entryFree id="n45228" type="hapax" key="stagna_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stagnātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stagnum</etym>, <sense id="n45228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <cb n="STAL" /> <hi rend="ital">belonging to ponds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pools</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 5, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stagnensis: <entryFree id="n45229" type="hapax" key="stagnensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stagnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stagnum</etym>. <sense id="n45229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to ponds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pools</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 1:103" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 1, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stagneus: <entryFree id="n45230" type="main" key="stagne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stagnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. stanneus.</entryFree>
stagninus: <entryFree id="n45231" type="hapax" key="stagni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stagnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stagnum</etym>, <sense id="n45231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resembling stagnant water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color perviridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 7</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
stagno: <entryFree id="n45232" type="main" key="stagno1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stagno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n45232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n45232.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45232.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to form a pool of standing water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stagnate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be stagnant</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">redundo): stagnans Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi mollius solum reperit (Indus) stagnat insulasque molitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam flumen, quo latius fusum est, hoc placidius stagnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae stagnantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagnantibus undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:95" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nili aquae, ubi evagatae stagnant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 22, § 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:31" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 3, 21, § 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagnante Pado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45232.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of places which lie under water, <hi rend="ital">to be overflowed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inundated</hi>: moenia oppidi stagnabant redundantibus cloacis, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludibus orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:89" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra caede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 40, § 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:43" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 43</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stagnantĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inundated places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae motus fervens in umidis, fluctuans in stagnantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 80, 82, § 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45232.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45232.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make stagnant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (bitumine) aqua omnis (Maris Mortui) stagnatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cecropio stagnata luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:20:110" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 20, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45232.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cover with water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overflow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundate</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis plana Urbis stagnaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(loca) stagnata paludibus ument,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 269</bibl></cit>; Col. poët. 10, 11.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45233" type="main" key="stagno2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stagno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>stagnum = stannum; cf. stagneus, s. v. stanneus</etym>. <sense id="n45233.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to overlay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plate with</hi> stannum (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> —</sense><sense id="n45233.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se adversus insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 37, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potionibus stagnata animalia,</quote> <trans><tr>strengthened</tr>, <tr>invigorated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stagnosus: <entryFree id="n45234" type="main" key="stagno_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stagnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stagnum</etym>, <sense id="n45234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of standing waters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pools</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Liternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:653" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagnosa et referta salicibus,</quote> <trans><tr>places full of pools</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stagnum: <entryFree id="n45235" type="main" key="stagnum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stagnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/nagos</foreign> = vadum</etym>. <sense id="n45235.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a piece of standing water</hi> (whether permanent or formed by the overflowing of a stream], <hi rend="ital">a pool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swamp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fen</hi>, etc. (cf.: lacus, palus): propter stagna, ubi lanigerum pecus piscibus pascit, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59</bibl> Müll. (Sat. v. 42 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">super ripas Tiberis effusus lenibus stagnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 2</bibl> (as an example for stativae aquae); Cic. poët. Div. 1, 9; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:77" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 323</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique latius Extenta Lucrino Stagna lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa stagna lacusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45235.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">waters</hi> in gen.: hiemem sensit Neptunus et imis Stagna refusa vadis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nerei Stagna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 764</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubri stagna profundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:853" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 853</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:282" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 282</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna tepentis aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit> (4, 17), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrixeae stagna sororis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Hellespont</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:278" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euripi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagnum ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>a lake of fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:19:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 19, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n45236" type="gloss" key="stagnum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stagnum</orth>, = stannum, whence 2. stagno, and the orthog. stagneus, for stanneus.</entryFree>
stagonias: <entryFree id="n45237" type="greek" key="sta^go^ni^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăgŏnĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stagoni/as</foreign> (dropping), <sense id="n45237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of frankincense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stagonitis: <entryFree id="n45238" type="greek" key="sta^go^ni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăgŏnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stagoni=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n45238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gum galbanum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 56, § 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staienus: <entryFree id="n45239" type="main" key="Sta_ie_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stāiēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. C. Aelius Paetus Staienus, <hi rend="ital">a judge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 20, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 64</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">as a proverb of bad oratory: Staieni et Autronii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:244" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 244</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">72, 251</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stalagmias: <entryFree id="n45240" type="greek" key="sta^lagmi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stălagmĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stalagmi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n45240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a natural vitriol</hi>, which distils in drops, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stalagmium: <entryFree id="n45241" type="greek" key="sta^lagmi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stălagmĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stala/gmion</foreign>, <sense id="n45241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ear-drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pendant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 18</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=317" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 317</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 45 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
stalagmus: <entryFree id="n45242" type="main" key="Sta_lagmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stālagmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 95</bibl>. <cb n="STAT" /></sense></entryFree>
stamen: <entryFree id="n45243" type="main" key="sta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the warp</hi> in the upright loom of the ancients (cf.: trama, subtemen). </sense><sense id="n45243.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=113" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 113</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:86" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:54 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 54 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 576</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 275</bibl>; 4, 397 al.—</sense><sense id="n45243.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n45243.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A thread</hi> hanging from the distaff: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ducunt lanas aut stamina pollice versant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 179</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 221</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 475: operoso stamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et minuent plenas stamina nostra colos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deducere plenā stamina longa colu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:86" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:78" default="NO">1, 6, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis dum torques stamina duris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 79</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">threads</hi> of the Parcae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:36" default="NO">3, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 453</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:13:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 13, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:777" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 777</bibl>. —Hence, de legibus queri Fatorum et nimio de stamine, <hi rend="ital">too long a thread of life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:252" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 252</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallebam stamine somnum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by spinning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45243.4" n="B" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">threads</hi> of other sorts; <cit><quote lang="la">thus, of the thread of Ariadne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 42; <cit><quote lang="la">of the spider,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 80</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a net,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>; of the <hi rend="ital">stamina</hi> of the lily, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 23</bibl>; the <hi rend="ital">fibres</hi> of wood, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 38, 73, § 186</bibl>; the <hi rend="ital">strings</hi> of an instrument, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 169</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45243.5" n="C" level="2"> (Pars pro toto.) <hi rend="ital">A cloth</hi> made of threads; so <hi rend="ital">the fillets</hi> of priests, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 9, 52; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:25" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 25</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A garment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 304</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 346</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staminatus: <entryFree id="n45244" type="hapax" key="sta_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stamen</etym>, <sense id="n45244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of threads</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
stamineus: <entryFree id="n45245" type="main" key="sta_mi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stāmĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of threads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of threads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thready</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rota rhombi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit> (4, 5), 26: <cit><quote lang="la">vena ligni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fibrous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stannatio: <entryFree id="n45246" type="main" key="stanna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stannātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trowel</hi> (late Lat.): stannatio sive trulla caementarii, Hier. in Amos, 3, 7.</sense></entryFree>
stannatura: <entryFree id="n45247" type="main" key="stanna_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stannātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plastering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">varnishing</hi> (late Lat.), Hier. in Amos, 3, 7.</sense></entryFree>
stanneus: <entryFree id="n45248" type="main" key="stanne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stannĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stagnĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stannum</etym>, <sense id="n45248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of</hi> stannum: vasa, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Fest. s. v. narica, p. 166 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 7, 19, § 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacabus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:42:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:38" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 5, 12, § 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stannum: <entryFree id="n45249" type="main" key="stannum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stannum</orth> (perh. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">stagnum</orth>; hence 2. stagno and stagneus, v. stanneus), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an alloy of silver and lead</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 16, 47, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:130" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 9, 45, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45249.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Tin</hi> (late Lat. for plumbum album or candidum), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Zach. 1, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphis: <entryFree id="n45250" type="greek" key="sta^phis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăphis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stafi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">licebane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">staves - acre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 13, § 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 27, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphyla: <entryFree id="n45251" type="main" key="Sta^phy^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăphyla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăphylē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stafulh/</foreign>, <sense id="n45251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphylinus: <entryFree id="n45252" type="greek" key="staphy^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">staphylīnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stafuli=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n45252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of parsnip</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 27, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:112" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9, 64, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:168" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphylodendron: <entryFree id="n45253" type="greek" key="sta^phy^lo^dendron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăphylŏdendron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stafulo/dendron</foreign>, <sense id="n45253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pistachio - tree</hi>: Staphylea pinnata, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 27, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphyloma: <entryFree id="n45254" type="greek" key="staphy^lo_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">staphylōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stafu/lwma</foreign>, <sense id="n45254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blemish in the eye</hi> shaped like a grape. stone, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 19, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphylus: <entryFree id="n45255" type="main" key="Staphy^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Staphylus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Silenus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who taught the art of mixing wine with water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staseas: <entryFree id="n45256" type="main" key="Stase^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stasĕas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Peripatetic philosopher of Neapolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:22:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 22, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 25, 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stasiastae: <entryFree id="n45257" type="main" key="Sta^si^astae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăsĭastae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stasiastai/</foreign>, <sense id="n45257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a tragedy of Attius</hi>, v. the Fragments, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 20, 25 al.</bibl>; Trag. Rel. p. 214 sqq. Rib.</sense></entryFree>
stasimum: <entryFree id="n45258" type="greek" key="sta^si^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăsĭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sta/simon</foreign>, <sense id="n45258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that part of a poem which was sung standing</hi>, Mar. Vict. 2, p. 2522 P.</sense></entryFree>
stasimus: <entryFree id="n45259" type="main" key="Sta^si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăsĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
statae: <entryFree id="n45260" type="gloss" key="sta^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătae mātris</orth> <itype>simulacrum in foro colebatur</itype>, identical with that of <sense id="n45260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Vesta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=317" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 317</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1386 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
statanum: <entryFree id="n45261" type="main" key="sta^ta_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătānum vīnum</orth>, <sense id="n45261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an excellent kind of wine</hi> in Campania, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:36" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 21, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statanus: <entryFree id="n45262" type="main" key="Sta^ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătānus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the deity who presided over the standing of children</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 532, 24 sq.</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 21.—As <hi rend="ital">a female deity</hi>, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătīna</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 39</bibl>. <pb n="1751" /> <cb n="STAT" /></sense></entryFree>
statarius: <entryFree id="n45263" type="main" key="sta^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to standing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">standing fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standing firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stationary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steady</hi> (very rare; usually stabilis). </sense><sense id="n45263.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">statarius miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that remain long in the water</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandium,</quote> <trans><tr>eaten standing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Jul. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congressio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a battle in the open field</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45263.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil;</hi> of an orator: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Piso, statarius et sermonis plenus orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:239" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 239</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45263.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătārĭa</orth> (sc. comoedia), <hi rend="ital">a kind of comedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called from the quiet acting of the performers</hi> (opp. motoria, bustling, noisy), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 36 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 36 sq.</bibl> Don. ad loc. and ad; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. prol. 24</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the actors in the</hi> comoedia stataria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 30, 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statelli: <entryFree id="n45264" type="main" key="Statelli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Statelli</orth>, v. Statielli.</entryFree>
stater: <entryFree id="n45265" type="greek" key="sta^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăter</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stath/r</foreign>, <sense id="n45265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small silver coin of the Jews</hi>, of the value of four drachmae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 3, 17, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:17:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 17, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statera: <entryFree id="n45266" type="main" key="sta^te_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perhaps kindred with <foreign lang="greek">sta/qmh</foreign>, a rule</etym>, <sense id="n45266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steelyard;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a balance</hi> (syn.: libra, trutina). </sense><sense id="n45266.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:46" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 46</bibl>: auraria, <hi rend="ital">a goldsmith's scales</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 455, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also aurificis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45266.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of any thing of a similar shape. * </sense><sense id="n45266.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The pole-bar</hi> of a chariot, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 35</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n45266.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of platter</hi>, so called from its resemblance to the scale of a steelyard or balance, Nep. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 52, § 146</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n45266.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the value</hi> of a thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 26, 57, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statianus: <entryFree id="n45267" type="main" key="Sta^ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a lieutenant of Antony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:82:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 82, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statice: <entryFree id="n45268" type="greek" key="sta^ti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">statikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n45268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb of an astringent quality</hi>: Statice armeria, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 33, § 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staticulum: <entryFree id="n45269" type="main" key="sta^ti^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>statua</etym>. <sense id="n45269.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little statue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a statuette</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 48, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:140" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 54, § 140</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45269.1" n="II" level="1"> Of <hi rend="ital">images of the gods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idols</hi>, as a transl. of the Heb. <foreign />, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 2</bibl> ex Deut. 12, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> ex Lev. 26, 1.</sense></entryFree>
staticulus: <entryFree id="n45270" type="main" key="sta^ti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of gentle dance</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statielli: <entryFree id="n45271" type="main" key="Statielli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Statielli</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Statelli</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Liguria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Their chief town</hi> was called Aquae Statiellorum, Plin. l. l.; or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Statĭellae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45271.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sta-tiellas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Statielli</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sta-tiellātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:21" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 21</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45271.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Statiellenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of</hi> Aquae Statiellorum, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statilius: <entryFree id="n45272" type="main" key="Sta^ti^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45272.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Statilius, <hi rend="ital">a fellow-conspirator with Catiline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes">46, 3</bibl>; 55, 6.—</sense><sense id="n45272.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Statilius, <hi rend="ital">an augur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 13</bibl> and 14.—</sense><sense id="n45272.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An indifferent actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45272.4" n="IV" level="1"> Statilius Taurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2725 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
statim: <entryFree id="n45273" type="main" key="sta^tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătim</orth> (a scanned long, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 397</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 180</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>sto</etym>. <sense id="n45273.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfastly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unyieldingly</hi> (so only ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nemo recedit loco, quin statim rem gerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 84</bibl></cit>; so, qui rem cum Achivis gesserunt statim, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 393, 14</bibl> (Trag. v. 39 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">statim stant signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 120</bibl></cit>: vectigalia legerunt vestra et servantur statim, <hi rend="ital">steadily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl> P. (statute et ordinate, Charis.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his praediis talenta argenti bina capiebat statim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: delaborat cum statim puer, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 393, 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45273.1" n="II" level="1"> Like our <hi rend="ital">on the spot</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straightway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instantly</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: continuo, confestim, extemplo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Publicola lege illā perlatā statim secures de fascibus demi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de se ter sortibus consultum dicebat, utrum igni statim necaretur, an in aliud tempus reservaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:200" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui discedere animum censent, alii statim dissipari, alii diu permanere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 9</bibl></cit>, <cb n="STAT" /> 18: <cit><quote lang="la">ut statim alienatio disjunctioque facienda sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremos in agmine temptare ac statim in collis regredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio anni statim res turbulentae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 53, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim ac sine morā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45273.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simul ac</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras scripsi horā decimā, statim, ut tuas legeram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim, ut dici (res) coepta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut heri me salutavit, statim Romam profectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicebat, statim se iturum, simul ac ludorum apparatum iis tradidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proconsul ubique proconsularia insignia habet statim atque Urbem egressus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proconsules, statim quam Urbem egressi fuerint, habent jurisdictionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen statim cum spargitur, obruendum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45273.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sum aggressus statim Catone absoluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium navibus captis statim ex classe copias suas eduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45273.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim a primā luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a primā statim maturitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 18, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami paene statim ab radice modici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 10, 18, § 41</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">post</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitationes campestres statim post civilia bella omisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim post putationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n45273.5" n="B" level="2"> Rarely for recenter, modo, <hi rend="ital">recently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">newly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventriculus vervecis statim occisi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statina: <entryFree id="n45274" type="main" key="Sta^ti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Statanus.</entryFree>
statio: <entryFree id="n45275" type="main" key="sta^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a standing still.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45275.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (so very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): navis, quae manet in statione,</quote> <trans><tr>remains standing</tr>, <tr>stands still</tr>, <tr>does not move</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 388</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">manere in statione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 396</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:478" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 478</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:518" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 518</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in statione locata nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 193</bibl></cit>: varas In statione manus et pugnae membra paravi, <hi rend="ital">in a firm posture</hi> (for fighting), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam id (sidus) stationem facere,</quote> <trans><tr>stands still</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 15, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes matutinas facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 12, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus immobilem stationis gradum retinens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:23" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45275.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which is established</hi> by custom or prescription, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qematismo/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45275.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in concr., a place where persons or things stay or abide, <hi rend="ital">a station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an abode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">residence.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45275.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Athenis statio mea nunc placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā positus fueris in statione, mane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:674" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 674</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:719" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 719</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio sedes apibus statioque petenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apricis statio gratissima mergis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a stall</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique in stationibus sedent tempusque audiendis fabulis conterunt,</quote> <trans><tr>in public places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes circumeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tabernas tris de domo suo circa forum civitatibus ad stationem locasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thermae, stationes, omne theatrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:4" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes municipiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 86, § 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad stationem vel tabernam ventum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes hibernae,</quote> <trans><tr>winter-quarters</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone recompositas in statione comas,</quote> <trans><tr>in their place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A.
