A. 3, 434</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">permutata rerum statione, Petr. poët. 120, 99: umoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45275.7" n="1" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi> (v. custodiae, vigilia): <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes ex statione et praesidio emissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii, qui pro portis castrorum in statione erant ... Cohortes quae in stationibus erant, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 32</bibl></cit>; 5, 15; 6, 37; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 38: in stationem succedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to relieve</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationem inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quique primi transierant, in statione erant, dum traicerent ceteri,</quote> <trans><tr>on guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: suis vicibus capiebant bina (lumina Argi) quietem; <cit><quote lang="la">Cetera servabant atque in statione manebant,</quote> <trans><tr>kept at their posts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 627</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 115</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de praesidio et statione vitae decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 20, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">functo longissimā statione mortali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:131:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 131, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii statione relictā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:219" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 219</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like our <cb n="STAT" /> <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, for those who are stationed to watch, who stand guard, <hi rend="ital">sentries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentinels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outposts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pickets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut stationes dispositas haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 69</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut minus intentae diurnae stationes ac nocturnae vigiliae essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38:16" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 38, 16</bibl>; cf. in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad stationem Romanam in portā segniter agentem vigilias perveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 32, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispositā statione per ripas Tiberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodiae stationesque equitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statione militum assumptā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>body-guard</tr>, <tr>lifeguard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, in government, etc. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in hac statione, i. e. the imperial office,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Ael. Verr. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statio imperatoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augusta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Clod. Alb. 2</bibl></cit>: regia, Vulc. 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Verr. 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.10" n="3" level="3"> Naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an anchorage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roadstead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">road</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inlet</hi> (syn. portus), Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietam nactus stationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 56</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 421</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 23 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45275.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A place of residence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi> of the fiscal officers of a province; also, for the <hi rend="ital">officers</hi> themselves, Cod. Th. 12, 6, 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.12" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A post-station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post-house</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1015</bibl>; Morcell. Stil. Inscr. Lat. 1, p. 421.—</sense><sense id="n45275.13" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A religious meeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assembly</hi> of the Christians: <cit><quote lang="la">die stationis, nocte vigiliae meminerimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes in vesperam producere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Psych. 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Ux. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stationalis: <entryFree id="n45276" type="hapax" key="sta^ti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>statio, I.</etym>, <sense id="n45276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">standing still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stationary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 15, 12, § 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stationarius: <entryFree id="n45277" type="main" key="sta^ti^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>statio, II.</etym>, <sense id="n45277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a post</hi> or <hi rend="ital">station</hi> (jurid. Lat.): stationarii milites, <hi rend="ital">soldiers stationed at a post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of gendarmery instituted by Augustus for suppressing the</hi> grassatores, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:4" default="NO">11, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:12:1" default="NO">1, 12, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n45277.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A postman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postmaster</hi> at a post - station, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 1.—</sense><sense id="n45277.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A police-officer</hi>, Cod. 12, 23, 1; 12, 58, 1; Cod. Th. 6, 29, 1; 8, 4, 2.</sense></entryFree>
statius: <entryFree id="n45278" type="main" key="Sta_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stātĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n45278.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">a name for slaves</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A slave of Cicero</hi> was thus named, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 1, § 1</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">a prœnomen of freemen</hi>, e. g. Statius Albius Oppianicus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 4, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45278.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname</hi> (cognomen or agnomen). </sense><sense id="n45278.2" n="A" level="2"> Caecilius Statius, <hi rend="ital">of Insubria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a comic poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a younger contemporary of Ennius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who died</hi> A. U. C. 586, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45278.3" n="B" level="2"> P. Papinius Statius, <hi rend="ital">a poet under Domitian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of the</hi> Silvae, <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> Thebais, <hi rend="ital">and of an unfinished poem entitled</hi> Achilleis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 82</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n45278.4" n="C" level="2"> L. Statius Murcus, <hi rend="ital">a lieutenant and proconsul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:77:4" default="NO">2, 77, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stativus: <entryFree id="n45279" type="main" key="sta^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">standing still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stationary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45279.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): de stativis aquis, ut sunt lacus et stagna et putea et maria, <hi rend="ital">standing waters</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 2</bibl>: tarditas, Firm. Math. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Of a light (transl. of Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sthrigmo/s</foreign>), App. de Mundo, 16, p. 64, 24.—</sense><sense id="n45279.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45279.3" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to posts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stations</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quarters</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word): praesidium stativum, <hi rend="ital">appointed post</hi> or <hi rend="ital">station</hi> = statio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 40, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <trans><tr>a stationary camp</tr>, <tr>a camp where an army halts for a long while</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45279.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătīva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a stationary camp.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45279.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 34, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 33, 6</bibl>; 37, 37, 1 and 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n45279.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of travellers: stativa, <hi rend="ital">a restingplace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stopping-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stativis dies absumuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 8</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n45279.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătīvae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansiones, deinde stativae, deinde ubi annona esset accipienda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45279.8" n="B" level="2"> In relig. lang.: stativae feriae, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stated feasts</hi> (usually statae feriae), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statones: <entryFree id="n45280" type="main" key="Statones"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Statones</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the people of Statonia in Southern Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its vines and stone-quarries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Statonĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Statonia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:95:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 95, 96</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1752" /> <cb n="STAT" /> § <cit><quote lang="la">209: vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 8</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Statonĭensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ager), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 49, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12</bibl>. 1.</sense></entryFree>
stator: <entryFree id="n45281" type="main" key="sta^tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a magistrate's attendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">messenger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orderly-man</hi> (since Augustus there were centuriae statorum Augusti): <cit><quote lang="la">statores mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; Planc. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:4" default="NO">1, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2780</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3422</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3524</bibl>; cf. Kellerm. Vigil. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">199</bibl> sq.; Jahn, Spec. Epigr. p. 28, n. 1; p. 49.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45282" type="main" key="Sta^tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sisto</etym>, one who causes any thing to stand fast, <sense id="n45282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supporter</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:793" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 793</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:131" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 131</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 53, 54, § 140</bibl>.—Also, of Mars, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:131:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 131, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statorius: <entryFree id="n45283" type="main" key="Statori^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Statorĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Statorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statua: <entryFree id="n45284" type="main" key="sta^tu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>statuo</etym>, <sense id="n45284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statue</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">signum, effigies, imago) (commonly made of metal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 10</bibl></cit>); rarely of the gods: statuae deorum, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 782</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:42:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 42, 1</bibl>.—But freq. and class. of men: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam dare auream Solidam faciundam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae et imagines, non animorum simulacra sed corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua istius persimilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 38, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua equestris inaurata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 15, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 38, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20, § 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea statua, quae ad Opis per te posita in excelso est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quaeret Pater urbium Subscribi statuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 28</bibl></cit>.—As a designation of immovability, taciturnity, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac statuā volo Erogitare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">statuā taciturnius exit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste statuā pallidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:80:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 80, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuarum ritu patiemur pannos et vincula?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45284.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pillar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmorea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Pasch. 1, 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statualis: <entryFree id="n45285" type="gloss" key="sta^tu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>statua</etym>, = STATVARIVS, <sense id="n45285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sculptor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 937, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statuarius: <entryFree id="n45286" type="main" key="sta^tu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to statues</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of making statues</tr>, <tr>statuary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 16, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:37" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatura (aeris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 97</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45286.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭ-ārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the art of statuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 15</bibl> (= ars fingendi). —</sense><sense id="n45286.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a maker of statues</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a statuary</hi> (syn. sculptor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statuliber: <entryFree id="n45287" type="main" key="sta^tu_li_ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūlīber</orth> (also separate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătū lī-ber</orth>), <itype>bĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prob. instead of statuto liber; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr></etym>, <sense id="n45287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slave to whom liberty is granted under a certain condition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from a certain time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally by testament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuliber est qui statutam et destinatam in tempus vel condicionem libertatem habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sub condicione testamento liber esse jussus est, statu liber appellatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> 2</bibl> passim: <cit><quote lang="la">statuliber est qui testamento certā condicione propositā jubetur esse liber, Fest. s. v. statuliber, p. 249 L.: statuliberi, id est ejus servi quo testamento sub aliquā condicione liber esse jussus est, quem constat interea heredis servum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:200" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 200</bibl></cit>: cum statuliber sub condicione legatus est, et pendente condicione legati condicio statutae libertatis deficit, legatum utile fit; <cit><quote lang="la">nam, sicut statuta libertas tunc perimit legatum cum vires accipit, ita, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:81:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 81, § 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:5:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 33, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:44:section=8" default="NO">30, 1, 44, § 8</bibl>; and the whole title of the <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7</bibl>, De statuliberis.—The word perhaps occurred in the XII. Tables: <cit><quote lang="la">sub hac condicione liber esse jussus ... ad libertatem perveniet: idque lex duodecim tabularum jubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statulinus: <entryFree id="n45288" type="main" key="Statuli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Statulīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Statanus.</entryFree>
statumaria: <entryFree id="n45289" type="main" key="sta^tu_ma_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūmārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> proserpinaca, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statumen: <entryFree id="n45290" type="main" key="sta^tu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūmen</orth>, <itype>īnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>statuo</etym>, <sense id="n45290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that upon which any thing rests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:16:2" default="NO">4, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:18" default="NO">5, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 24, § 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45290.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a rib</hi> of a ship, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statuminatio: <entryFree id="n45291" type="hapax" key="sta^tu_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>statumino</etym>, <sense id="n45291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an underpropping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
statumino: <entryFree id="n45292" type="main" key="sta^tu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>statumen</etym>, <sense id="n45292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to underprop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (post-Aug.): <cb n="STAT" /> oras fossarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statunculum: <entryFree id="n45293" type="hapax" key="sta^tuncu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătuncŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>statua</etym>, <sense id="n45293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little statue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statuette</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 50, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statuo: <entryFree id="n45294" type="main" key="sta^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>stătum, sup. of sto</etym>, <sense id="n45294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to stand</hi> (cf.: colloco, pono). </sense><sense id="n45294.1" n="I" level="1"> Corporeally. </sense><sense id="n45294.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix in an upright position.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi arbores pedicino in lapide statuito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter parietes arbores ubi statues,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites statuito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palis statutis crebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedamenta jacentia statuenda,</quote> <trans><tr>are to be raised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedamentum inter duas vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 21, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic statui volo primum aquilam,</quote> <trans><tr>the standard of the troops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signifer, statue signum,</quote> <trans><tr>plant the ensign</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 55, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To plant</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">eodem modo vineam statuito, alligato, flexatoque uti fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agro qui statuit meo Te, triste lignum (i. e. arborem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.5" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set forth</hi> things or persons. </sense><sense id="n45294.6" n="a" level="4"> Without specifying the place: <cit><quote lang="la">ollam statuito cum aquā,</quote> <trans><tr>let a jar stand with water</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit> (157): <cit><quote lang="la">crateras magnos statuunt, i. e. on the table,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 724</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">crateras laeti statuunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 147</bibl></cit>: haec carina satis probe fundata et bene statuta est, <hi rend="ital">well placed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">so that the hull stands</hi> perpendicularly (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bene lineatam carinam collocavit, v. 42),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quidquam explicare, nec statuere potuerant, nec quod statutum esset, manebat, omnia perscindente vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo die tabernacula statui passus non est,</quote> <trans><tr>to pitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 81</bibl></cit>; so, aciem statuere, <hi rend="ital">to draw up an army</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem quam arte statuerat, latius porrigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.7" n="b" level="4"> With designation of the place by <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; by <hi rend="ital">adv. of place;</hi> by <hi rend="ital">ante</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">super</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and acc.;</hi> by <hi rend="ital">pro</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; by <case>abl.</case> alone (very rare), or by <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (very rare): signa domi pro supellectile statuere, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 7, 19, 95</bibl> (p. 782 P.): <cit><quote lang="la">statuite hic lectulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi in caelo Capitolium statueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:46:180" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 46, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuitur Sollius in illo gladiatorum convivio ... atuitur, ut dico, eques Romanus in Apronii convivio,</quote> <trans><tr>is taken to the banquet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=61 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 61 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernacula in foro statuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in principiis statuit tabernaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostris castris tibi tabernaculum statue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:20" default="NO">8, 13, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statui in medium undique conspicuum tabernaculum jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sagittae) longae, nisi prius in terrā statuerent arcum, haud satis apte imponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes curules sacerdotum Augustalium locis, superque eas querceae coronae statuerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donum deae apud Antium statuitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro rigidis calamos columnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:529" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque ratem Scythicis auster statuisset in oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:653" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuere vas in loco frigido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 22</bibl></cit>.—Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">capite in terram statuerem, Ut cerebro dispergat viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui capite ipse sua in statuit vestigia sese (= qui sese ipse capite in sua vestigia statuit),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stands on his head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem ejus a mortuis excitasses, statuisses ante oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:57:245" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 57, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivos vinctos in medio statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum equus Curtium in vado statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor cohortes in fronte statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 33, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante se statuit funditores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 58, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum ad canendum ante tibicinem cum statuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul in conspectu eum (Philopoemenem) statuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 49, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">media porta robora legionum, duabus circa portis milites levemque armaturam statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bovem ad fanum Dianae et ante aram statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 45, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Calchanta circa aram statuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>, ext. 6: <cit><quote lang="la">marium si qui eo loci statuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes ante Caesarem statuunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fronte statuerat ferratos, in cornibus cohortes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer quis Ad cyathum statuetur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu cum pro vitulā statuis dulcem Aulide natam Ante aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et statuam ante aras auratā fronte juvencum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarā regione profundi Aetheros innumeri statuerunt agmina cygni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:525" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 525</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.8" n="4" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to construct and place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set up after constructing</hi>,<cb n="STAT" />  <hi rend="ital">to erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.9" n="a" level="4"> Of statues, temples, columns, altars, trophies, etc.; constr. with <case>acc.</case> alone, or <hi rend="ital">acc. of the structure</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. of the person</hi> for whom or in whose honor it is erected: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem mihi aram et statuam statuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic statuam statui decet ex auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ego aureā pro statuā vineam tibi statuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eique statuam equestrem in rostris statui placere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 15, 41</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 5, 10</bibl>; 9, 7, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:62:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 62, § 151</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 20, § 48</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum alicui statuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mancinus eo habitu sibi statuit quo, etc. (effigiem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 10, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum in curiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quānam in civitate tempium statueretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se primos templum urbis Romae statuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 56</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tibi de Pario statuam, Germanice, templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa tibi statuam, tribuam tibi turis honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super terrae tumulum noluit quid statui nisi columellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victimas atque aras diis Manibus statuentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuitque aras e cespite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuantur arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 579" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 579</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëneum statuerunt tropaeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 70; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in alio orbe tropaea statuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 18</bibl></cit>: ut illum di perdant qui primus statuit hic solarium, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps Romanis solarium horologium statuisse L. Papirius Cursor proditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 60, 60, § 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a miliario in capite Romani fori statuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carceres eo anno in Circo primum statuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo molem hanc immanis equi statuere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo altiorem statui crucem jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obeliscam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 9, 14, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at nunc disturba quas statuisti machinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incensis operibus quae statuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vallum statuitur procul urbis illecebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra in quinto lapide a Carthagine statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem statuere = alicui statuam statuere: inter et Aegidas mediā statuaris in urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuarque tumulo hilaris et coronatus,</quote> <trans><tr>my statue will be erected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 13</bibl></cit>; so with two <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: custodem medio statuit quam vilicus horto, <hi rend="ital">whose statue he placed as protectress</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:68:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 68, 9</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in double sense: nudam te statuet, i. e. nudam faciet (= nudabit fortunis), and statuam tibi nu dam faciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:28:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 28, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.11" n="5" level="3"> Of cities, etc., <hi rend="ital">to establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build</hi> (in class. prose usu. condo): <cit><quote lang="la">Agamemnon tres ibi urbes statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem quam statuo vestra est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbom praeclaram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persarum statuit Babylona Semiramis urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi civitatem statuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">licentia et impunitas asyla statuendi (= aperiendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 60</bibl></cit>.—Hence, transf.: carmen statuere = carmen condere, <hi rend="ital">to compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise a song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc volucrum ... inexpertum carmen, quod tacitā statuere brumā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to stand still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stop</hi> (rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sisto, III. B.): navem extemplo statuimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et statuit fessos, fessus et ipse, boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">famuli hoc modo statuerunt aquas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 30</bibl></cit>: sanguinem, Oct. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.13" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to stand firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (rare; = stabilire), only transf.: qui rem publicam certo animo adjuverit, statuerit, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:56:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 56, 120</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 357 Rib.).</sense><sense id="n45294.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45294.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constitute</hi> (= constituo). </sense><sense id="n45294.16" n="1" level="3"> Esp.: exemplum or documentum (v. edo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 320" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 320</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to set forth an example</hi> or <hi rend="ital">precedent</hi> for warning or imitation: <cit><quote lang="la">statuite exemplum impudenti, date pudori praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum statuite in me ut adulescentuli Vobis placere studeant potius quam sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 35, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illi intellegere possint, in quo homine statueris exemplum hujus modi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:45:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 45, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quos aliquid exempli populus Romanus statui putat oportere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 90</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">210: statuam in te exemplum, ne quis posthac infelicibus miseriis patriae illudat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:7:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">documentum autem statui oportere, si quis resipiscat et antiquam societatem respiciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: statueretur immo <pb n="1753" /> <cb n="STAT" /> documentum, quo uxorem imperator acciperet, <hi rend="ital">a precedent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.17" n="2" level="3"> Jus statuere, <hi rend="ital">to establish a principle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relation of law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (majores nostri) omnia omnium rerum jura statuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: qui magistratum potestatemve habebit, si quid in aliquem novi juris statuerit, ipse quoque, adversario postulante, eodem jure uti debebit, <hi rend="ital">if he has established any new principle of law</hi>, Edict. Praet. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 2, 1, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid injungere inferiori velis, id prius in te ac tuos si ipse juris statueris, facilius omnes oboedientes habeas,</quote> <trans><tr>if you first admit it against yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dicemus in omnibus aequabile jus statui convenire,</quote> <trans><tr>equal principles of law should be applied to all</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45294.18" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to establish</hi> by authority (of relations, institutions, rights, duties, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Numa) omnis partis religionis statuit sanctissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc judicium sic exspectatur ut non unae rei statui, sed omnibus constitui putetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad formandos animos statuendasque vitae leges, Quint. prooem. 14: sic hujus (virtutis) ut caelestium statuta magnitudo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 79:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 79, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal etiam novum ex salariā annonā statuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novos statuere fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eos quos statuit terminos observat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus cum pax statuta esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:10:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 10, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedesque ibi statuentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.19" n="4" level="3"> With double <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to constitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">create</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hirtius arbitrum me statuebat non modo hujus rei, sed totius consulatus sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1</bibl></cit>, a, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">telluris erum natura nec illum, nec quemquam constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de principatu (vinorum) se quisque judicem statuet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectus his statuitur Andragoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.20" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, etc. (of temporal or local relations); constr. usually with <case>acc.</case> and <case>dat.</case> or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.21" n="1" level="3"> Modum statuere alicui or alicujus rei, <hi rend="ital">to determine the manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mode</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">measure</hi> of, <hi rend="ital">assign limits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrictions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">restraints</hi> to a thing or person, <hi rend="ital">to impose restraints upon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.22" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturnitati imperii modum statuendum putavistis,</quote> <trans><tr>that a limit should be assigned to the duration of his power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statui mihi tum modum et orationi meae,</quote> <trans><tr>imposed restraints upon myself and my words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non statuendo felicitati modum, nec cohibendo fortunam,</quote> <trans><tr>by not assigning any limits to his success</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30, 23</bibl></cit> (Pompeium) affirmabant, libertati publicae statuturum modum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidinibus statuat natura modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem modum sibi ipsa statuit (crudelitas)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">modum ipsae res statuunt (i. e. sibi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 15, 61, § 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum nuptiarum sumptibus statuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timori quem meo statuam modum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 483" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 483</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with finem: jam statui aerumnis modum et finem cladi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 206" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 206</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45294.23" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestius te inimicitiarum modum statuere potuisse quam me humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse modum statuam carminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errorisque sui sic statuisse modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit> (4, 11), 36: <cit><quote lang="la">modum statuunt fellis pondere denarii,</quote> <trans><tr>they limit the quantity of the gall to the weight of a denarius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 77, § 254</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.24" n="2" level="3"> Condicionem or legem alicui, <hi rend="ital">to impose a condition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">law upon one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dictate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign a condition to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc tu condicionem statuis Gaditanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">providete ne duriorem vobis condicionem statuatis ordinique vestro quam ferre possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter eam sibi legem statuerat ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: pretio statutā lege ne modum excederet, etc., <hi rend="ital">the law being assigned to the price that not</hi>, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">the price being limited by the law</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis legem universae Graeciae statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—So with ellipsis of <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to agree upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statutis condicionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus consentientibus Carthago conditur, statuto annuo vectigali pro solo urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 5, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45294.25" n="3" level="3"> Finem, <hi rend="ital">to assign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put an end to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an end of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud opinor commode Finem statuisse orationi militem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et finem statuit cuppedinis atque timoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Fulvius Flaccus finem poenae eorum statuere cogeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: majores vestri omnium magnarum rerum et principia exorsi <cb n="STAT" /> ab diis sunt, et finem statuerunt, <hi rend="ital">finished</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39, 10</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terminum: nam templis numquam statuetur terminus aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:180" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum consilii tui bene fortiterque suscepti eum tibi finem statueris, quem ipsa fortuna terminum nostrarum contentionum esse voluisset,</quote> <trans><tr>since you have assigned that end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.26" n="4" level="3"> Pretium alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to assign a price to something; fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine the price of something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae probast mers, pretium ei statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam avare pretium statui arti meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit frumento pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 87</bibl></cit>; so with <case>dat.</case> understood: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eos (obsides) pretio quantum ipsi statuissent patres redimi paterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 42, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium statuit (i. e. vecturae et sali),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 29, 13</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: ut in singulas amphoras (vini) centeni nummi statuantur, <hi rend="ital">that the price may be set down at</hi> 100 <hi rend="ital">sesterces for an amphora</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.27" n="5" level="3"> Statuere diem, horam, tempus, locum alicui rei, or alicui, or with <hi rend="ital">dat. gerund.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appoint a day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, etc. (for the more usual diem dicere): <cit><quote lang="la">statutus est comitiis dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem patrando facinori statuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:35:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 35, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudini diem statuit ante quam sine fraude liceret ab armis discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies insidiis statuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 70, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tempus locumque colloquio statuendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subverti leges quae sua spatia (= tempora) quaerendis aut potiundis honoribus statuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 36</bibl></cit>.—With ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">observans quem statuere diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:54:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 54, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem unam poscit: statuitur nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 44</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> statutus, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appointed</hi> (in MSS. and edd. often confounded with status; v. sisto <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">institum ut quotannis ... libri diebus statutis (statis) recitarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut die statutā omnes equos ante regiam producerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam (genera) statutum tempus anni habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges quoque maturitatem statuto tempore expectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificium non esse redditum statuto tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuto tempore quo urbem Mithridati traderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad statutam horam omnes convenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra tempus statutum,</quote> <trans><tr>fixed by the law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit> and 20.—</sense><sense id="n45294.28" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To recount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">count up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi> (very rare): statue sex et quinquaginta annos, quibus mox divus Augustus rempublicam rexit: adice Tiberii tres et viginti ... centum et viginti anni colliguntur, <hi rend="ital">count</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi> the number <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cinyphiae segetis citius numerabis aristas ... quam tibi nostrorum statuatur summa laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.29" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To decide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>, with reference to a result, <hi rend="ital">to settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a decision.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.30" n="1" level="3"> Of disputes, differences, questions, etc., between others. </sense><sense id="n45294.31" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut statuatis hoc judicio utrum posthac amicitias clarorum virorum calamitati hominibus an ornamento esse malitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 28, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam potestatem habetis ut statuatis utrum nos ... semper miseri lugeamus, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc homine statuatis, possitne senatoribus judicantibus homo nocentissim us pecuniosissimusque damnari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos statuite, recuperatores, utra (sententia) utilior esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decidis tu statuisque quid iis ad denarium solveretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni esse judicis statuere quid quemque cuique praestare oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi vero Pompeius statuisse videtur quid vos in judicando spectare oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel (senatus) statuerent quid donatum Masinissae vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quid faciendum modo sit statuunt, sed, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>decide</tr>, <tr>dictate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum statuerat conservaret eum necne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statutumque (est) quantum curules, quantum plebei pignoris caperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 28</bibl></cit>: semel nobis esse statuendum quod consilium in illo sequamur, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45294.32" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consules de Caesaris actis cognoscerent, statuerent, judicarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, B, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">et collegas suos de religione statuisse, in senatu de lege statuturos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de absente eo C. Licinius statueret ac judicaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si de summā rerum liberum senatui permittat rex statuendi jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 62</bibl></cit>: qui ab exercitu ab imperatore eove cui de eā re statuendi potestas fuerit, dimissus erit, Edict. Praet. in <cb n="STAT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>.—Often with reference to punishment: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de P. Lentulo ceterisque statuetis, pro certo habetote, vos simul de exercitu Catilinae decernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis visum de Vestiliā statuere,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass sentence against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus statuendi de procuratoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta patribus potestate statuendi de Caeciliano,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 14</bibl>; 2, 85; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—In partic.: de se statuere, <hi rend="ital">to decide on</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dispose of one's self</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of one's life</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">to commit suicide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum qui de se statuebant humabantur corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.33" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case> and <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quibusdam populis permittendum esse videatur ut statuant ipsi de suis rebus quo jure uti velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.34" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consequeris tamen ut eos ipsos quos contra statuas aequos placatosque dimittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 34</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">indef. obj.</hi>, usu. a <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum igitur hoc Graeci statuent ... an nostri praetores?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixisti quippiam: fixum (i. e. id) et statutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:30:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 30, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eoque utrique quod statuit contenti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus, ne quid absente rege statueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 24, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturato opus est, quidquid statuere placet (senatui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ubi in P. Licinio ita statutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogatus quid ipse victorem statuere debere censeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:43" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in futurum statuerim, aperiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque rata essent quae procuratores sui in judicando statuerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">qul statuit aliquid parte inauditā alterā, aequum licet statuerit, haud aequus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 2:199" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 2, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ergo quod libet statuere arbiter potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:32:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 32, § 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">earum rerum quas Caesar statuisset, decrevisset, egisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, 11.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <hi rend="ital">super</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos de crudelissimis parricidis quid statuatis cunctamini?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil super eā re nisi ex voluntate filii statuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid super tantā re absente principe statueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, mostly
