<hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita expediri posse consilium ut pro merito cujusque statueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc ut quaeque causa erit statuetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 53, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ex rumore statuendum,</quote> <trans><tr>decisions should not be founded on rumors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 69</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">cognoscere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi> (<hi rend="ital">officially</hi>) <hi rend="ital">and decide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">petit ut vel ipse de eo causā cognitā statuat, vel civitatem statuere jubeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuli ut cognosceret statueretque senatus permiserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missuros qui de eorum controversiis cognoscerent statuerentque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 13, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod causā cognitā erit statuendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:2:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 11, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.35" n="2" level="3"> With reference to the mind of the subject, <hi rend="ital">to decide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make up one's mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be convinced</hi>, usu. with <hi rend="ital">interrog.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam intellegis, statuendum tibi esse, utrum illi homicidae sint an vindices libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud mirum videri solet, tot homines ... statuere non potuisse, utrum judicem an arbitrum, rem an litem dici oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tamen possum statuere, utrum magis mirer, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi statuerent, quo tempore possent suo jure arma capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut statuerem quid esset faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuere enim qui sit sapiens, vel maxime videtur esse sapientis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si habes jam statutum quid tibi agendum putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quantum tribuendum nobis putes statuas ipse, et, ut spero, statues ex nostrā dignitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix statui posse utrum quae pro se, an quae contra fratrem petiturus esset ab senatu magis impetrabilia forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam satis statuerat, utram foveret partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse ipsam Liviam statuere, nubendum post Drusum, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statue quem poenae extrahas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 661" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 661</bibl></cit>.—So with apud animum, <hi rend="ital">to make up one's mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix statuere apud animum meum possum atrum pejor ipsa res an pejore exemplo agatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ipsi primum statuerent apud animos quid vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 39, 11</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">neutr</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid nos de communi sententiā statuerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic statue, quidquid statuis, ut causam famamque tuam in arto stare scias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1306" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1306</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.36" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prescribe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.37" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: statuunt ut decem milia hominum in oppidum submittantur,<pb n="1754" /> <cb n="STAT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos (Siculos) statuisse ut hoc quod dico postularet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:42:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 42, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuunt illi atque decernunt ut eae litterae ... removerentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">173: statuit iste ut arator  ... vadimonium promitteret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">38: orare patres ut statuerent ne absentium nomina reciperentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">103: statuitur ne post M. Brutum proconsulem sit Creta provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tiberius) auxit patrum honorem statuendo ut qui ad senatum provocavissent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuiturque (a senatu) ut ... in servitute haberentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 53</bibl></cit>.—So of a decree, determination, or agreement by several persons or parties to be carried out by each of them: <cit><quote lang="la">statutum esse (inter plebem et Poenos) ut ... impedimenta diriperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses cum statuerent, ut urbe relictā naves conscenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuunt ut fallere custodes tentent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 84</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45294.38" n="2" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">remedium statuere,</quote> <trans><tr>to prescribe a remedy against public abuses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar ducentesimam (vectigalis) in posterum statuit,</quote> <trans><tr>decreed that one half of one per cent. be the tax</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">sic</hi> (= hoc): <cit><quote lang="la">sic, di, statuistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 661</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.39" n="3" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case> and <case>acc.</case> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">eis (Vestalibus) stipendium de publico statuit,</quote> <trans><tr>decreed</tr>, <tr>allowed a salary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurelio quoque annuam pecuniam statuit princeps,</quote> <trans><tr>decreed</tr>, <tr>granted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduum criminibus obiciendis statuitur,</quote> <trans><tr>are allowed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque et alimenta pueris statuta ... et patribus praemia statuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu Aeolus insanis statuat certamina ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:300" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hoc statui sub tempore rebus occasum Aeoniis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuere alicui munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:566" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 566</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.40" n="4" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur his quoque statuisti quantum ex hoc genere frumenti darent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo iis quo quisque die supplicarent, statutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 28, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.41" n="5" level="3"> In partic., of punishment, etc., <hi rend="ital">to decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measure out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflict.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.42" n="(a)" level="5"> With poenam, etc., with or without <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">considerando ... in utrā (lege) major poena statuatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam statui par fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non judicium, sed poenam statui videbant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem poena in Catum Firmium statuitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatu universo in socios facinoris ultimam statuente poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with mercedem (= poenam): debuisse gravissimam temeritatis mercedem statui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 55, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: Thrasea, non quidquid nocens reus pati mereretur, id egregio sub principe statuendum disseruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 48</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non debere eripi patribus vim statuendi (sc. poenas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.43" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indef. obj.</hi>, generally with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: aliquid gravius in aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to proceed severely against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecrare coepit, ne quid gravius in fratrem statueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac aliquid gravius in Hejum statuisse Mamertinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res monet cavere ab illis magis quam quid in illos statuamus consultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum triste aliquid statuit, fit tristis et ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:119" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ob eam rem de se crudelius statuerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.44" n="(g)" level="5"> With a word expressing the kind of punishment (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in Pompeiam Sabinam exilium statuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl></cit> (18).—</sense><sense id="n45294.45" n="(d)" level="5"> De capite, <hi rend="ital">to pass sentence of death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem illam praeclaram quae de capite civis Romani nisi comitiis centuriatis statui vetaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.46" n="E" level="2"> Referring to one's own acts, <hi rend="ital">to resolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to propose</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (first in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and class.): statuit ab initio et in eo perseveravit, jus publicano non dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Clodius cum statuisset omni scelere in praeturā vexare rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuerat excusare,</quote> <trans><tr>to decline the office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum statuissem scribere ad te aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod iste certe statuerat et deliberaverat non adesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se statuisse animum advertere in omnes nauarchos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">105: nam statueram in perpetuum tacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statueram ... nihil de illo dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:Clod. 1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fragm. Clod. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statueram rectā Appiā Romam (i. e. venire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius statuerat bello decertare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 86</bibl></cit>: si cedere hinc statuisset,<cb n="STAT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 39, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphare mense Januario statuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immemor sim propositi quo statui non ultra attingere externa nisi qua Romanis cohaererent rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex quamquam dissimulare statuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opperiri ibi hostium adventum statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 54, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut statuisse non pugnare consules cognitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 45, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exaugurare fana statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 55, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delphos mittere statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos deducere in agros statuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradere se, ait, moenia statuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnitium exercitus certamine ultimo fortunam experiri statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit sic adfectos hosti non obicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub idem tempus statuit senatus Carthaginem excidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statui pauca disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoliri juvenem specie honoris statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuerat urbem novam condere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuerat parcere urbi conditae a Cyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex statuerat inde abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander statuerat ex Syriā petere Africam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:24" default="NO">10, 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:27" default="NO">5, 27</bibl> (9), 13; so, <cit><quote lang="la">statutum habere cum animo ac deliberatum,</quote> <trans><tr>to have firmly and deliberately resolved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41, § 95</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis initium fecisset a me, sic enim statuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 7, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.47" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare as a judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be of opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi> (especially of legal opinions), <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi> (always implying the establishment of a principle, or a decided conviction; cf.: existimo, puto, etc.). </sense><sense id="n45294.48" n="1" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.49" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consulta falsa delata ab eo judicavimus ... leges statuimus per vim et contra auspicia latas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit senatus hoc ne illi quidem esse licitum cui concesserat omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:35:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 35, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin is tamen (judex) statuat fieri non posse ut de isto non severissime judicetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">144: hujusce rei vos (recuperatores) statuetis nullam esse actionem qui obstiterit armatis hominibus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 13, 39</bibl></cit>, ut quisquam juris numeretur peritus, qui id statuit esse jus quod non oporteat judicari, <hi rend="ital">who holds that to be the law</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is (Pompeius) se in publico statuit esse non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu unquam tantam plagam tacitus accipere potuisses, nisi hoc ita statuisses, quidquid dixisses te deterius esse facturum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si causa cum causā contenderet, nos nostram perfacile cuivis probaturos statuebamus,</quote> <trans><tr>we were sure</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non statuit sibi quidquam licere quod non patrem suum facere vidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:90:section=211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 90, § 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi sibi nullam societatem communis utilitatis causā statuunt esse cum civibus,</quote> <trans><tr>assume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum igitur statuisset opus esse ad eam rem constituendam pecuniā,</quote> <trans><tr>had become convinced</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo cive neminem ego statuo in hac re publicā esse fortiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam quidem laudem sapientiae statuo esse maximam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc anno statuit temporis esse satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolim statuas me mente malignā id facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 37</bibl></cit>.— So with <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim sic statuas tuas mihi litteras longissimas quasque gratissimas fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sic statuo a me in hac causā pietatis potius quam defensionis partes esse susceptas,</quote> <trans><tr>I hold</tr>, <tr>lay down as the principle of my defence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sic statuit omnino consularem legem nullam putare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic statuo et judico, neminem tot et tanta habuisse ornamenta dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:28:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 28, 122</bibl></cit>. —Hence, statui, <hi rend="ital">I have judged</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I know</hi>, and statueram, <hi rend="ital">I had judged</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I knew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ego qui in te satis consilii statuerim esse, mallem Peducaeum tibi consilium dare quam me, ironically,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui saepe audissent, nihil esse pulchrius quam Syracusarum moenia, statuerant se, si ea Verre praetore non vidissent, numquam esse visuros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:36:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 36, § 95</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dicam non recte aliquid statuere eos qui consulantur,</quote> <trans><tr>that they hold an erroneous opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 24, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis hoc statuit umquam, aut cui concedi potest, ut eum jure potuerit occidere a quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:24:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 24, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.50" n="b" level="4"> Particularly of a conclusion drawn from circumstances, <hi rend="ital">to judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude; declare</hi> (as an inference): <cit><quote lang="la">cum tuto senatum haberi non posse judicavistis, tum statuiistis, etiam intra muros Antonii scelus versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: quod si aliter statuetis,<cb n="STAT" />  videte ne hoc vos statuatis, qui vivus decesserit, ei vim non esse factam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 16, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? si tu ipse statuisti, bona P. Quinctii ex edicto possessa non esse?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 24, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ad fidem bonam statuit pertinere notum esse emptori vitium quod nosset venditor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter esse pium statuit quodcumque juvaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 133</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (i. e. litteris Gabinii credendum non esse) statuit senatus cum frequens supplicationem Gabinio denegavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si tum statuit opus esse, quid cum ille decessisset, Flacco existimatis statuendum et faciendum fuisse?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 12, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 16, 46</bibl>, supra; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hoc si ita statuetis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.51" n="c" level="4"> Esp. with <hi rend="ital">gerund.-clause.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.52" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acknowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that something must be done</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">should have been done</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu cum tuos amicos in provinciam quasi in praedam invitabas ... non statuebas tibi de illorum factis rationem esse reddendam?</quote> <trans><tr>did you not consider</tr>, <tr>did it not strike you?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:11:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 11, § 29</bibl></cit>: statuit, si hoc crimen extenuari vellet, nauarchos omnes vitā esse privandos, <hi rend="ital">he thought it necessary to deprive</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 40</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">103: ut statuas mihi non modo non cedendum, sed etiam tuo auxilio utendum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuebam sic, boni nihil ab illis nugis expectandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antigonus statuit aliquid sibi consilii novi esse capiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 4</bibl></cit>. —So with opus fuisse: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hoc statuatis oratione longā nihil opus fuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>acknowledge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 56</bibl></cit>: causam sibi dicendam esse statuerat jam ante quam hoc usu venit, <hi rend="ital">knew</hi> (cf. a. supra), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 39</bibl>, § 101. —</sense><sense id="n45294.53" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To think that one must do something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propose</hi>, usu. with <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manendum mihi statuebam quasi in vigiliā quādam consulari ac senatoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: quae vobis fit injuria si statuimus, vestro nobis judicio standum esse, <hi rend="ital">if we conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abide</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea quae statuisses tibi in senatu dicenda, reticeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit tamen nihil sibi in tantis injuriis gravius faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar statuit exspectandam classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non expectandum sibi statuit dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eo tempore statuerat non esse faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit sibi nihil agitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus statuit alio more bellum gerendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laco statuit accuratius sibi agendum cum Pharnabazo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sororis filios tollendos statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.54" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si, ut Manilius statuebat, sic est judicatum (= ut judicandum esse statuebat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut veteres statuerunt poetae (ut = quod ita esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=267" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 267</bibl></cit> (33): quae majora auribus accepta sunt quam oculis noscuntur, ut statuit, <hi rend="ital">as he thought</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that those things were greater</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset, ut ego mihi statuo, talis qualem te esse video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 14, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.55" n="3" level="3"> With two <case>acc.</case> (= duco, existimo): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes qui libere de re publicā sensimus, statuit ille quidem non inimicos, sed hostes,</quote> <trans><tr>regarded not as adversaries</tr>, <tr>but as foes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anaximenes aëra deum statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:10:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem summum bonum statuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video Lentulum cujus ego parentem deum ac patronum statuo fortunae ac nominis mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si rectum statuerimus concedere amicis quidquid velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hieronymus summum bonum statuit non dolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster vero Plato Titanum e genere statuit eos qui ... adversentur magistratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretum postulat, quo justae inter patruos fratrumque filias nuptiae statuerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum in praesentiā statuit reponere odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 39</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, i. e. baculo, <hi rend="ital">propped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leaning</hi> on a stick (dub. v. I. C. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">vidistis senem ... statutum, ventriosum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stă-tūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statute</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parcarum leges ac statuta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuta Dei et placita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 25, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statura: <entryFree id="n45295" type="main" key="sta^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>status, from sto; prop. a standing upright, an upright posture; hence</etym>, <sense id="n45295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">height</hi> or <hi rend="ital">size</hi> of the body, <hi rend="ital">stature.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45295.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(vir) commodā staturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: staturā haud magnā, id. <pb n="1755" /> <cb n="STAT" /> Poen. 5, 2, 152: pro facie, pro staturā, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim mihi dicas, L. Turselius quā facie fuerit, quā staturā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis nostri partes totaque figura et forma et statura, quam apta ad naturam sit, apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">corporis (corresp. to figura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse (citharoedus) formā et specie sit et staturā appositā ad dignitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva statura (hominis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 33, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines tantulae staturae,</quote> <trans><tr>of so small a stature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ali staturam, ali hoc vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45295.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals or plants, <hi rend="ital">size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growth</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Altinae vaccae sunt humilis staturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">producere vitem in tantam staturam, quantam permittit agricola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
staturosus: <entryFree id="n45296" type="main" key="sta^tu_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>statura</etym>, <sense id="n45296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of great stature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gigantic</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
status: <entryFree id="n45297" type="main" key="sta^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sisto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45298" type="main" key="sta^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sto and sisto</etym>. <sense id="n45298.0" n="I" level="1"> In a corporeal sense. </sense><sense id="n45298.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mode</hi> or <hi rend="ital">way of standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of holding one's body</hi> (at rest), <hi rend="ital">posture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carriage; sing.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">plur.: Ps.</hi> Statur hic ad hunc modum. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Statum vide hominis, Callipho, quasi basilicum, <hi rend="ital">look at the way he stands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat in statu senex ut adoriatur moechum,</quote> <trans><tr>in an attitude of attack</tr>, <tr>ready</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: concrepuit digitis, laborat; <cit><quote lang="la">crebro conmutat status,</quote> <trans><tr>his posture</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui esset status (videre vellem) flabellulum tenere te asinum tantum,</quote> <trans><tr>what your attitude was</tr>, <tr>what figure you cut</tr>, <tr>in holding the fan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gestu status (oratoris erit) erectus et celsus, rarus incessus,</quote> <trans><tr>attitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status quidem rectus sit, sed diducti paulum pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:159" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abesse plurimum a saltatore debet orator ... non effingere status quosdam, et quidquid dicet ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut recta sint bracchia, ne indoctae rusticaeve manus, ne status indecorus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare solitus Socrates dicitur ... immobilis, iisdem in vestigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumque silens astat, status est vultusque diserti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statum proeliantis componit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 95 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— <cit><quote lang="la">So of the pose of statues: non solum numerum signorum, sed etiam uniuscujusque magnitudinem, figuram, statum litteris definiri vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:21:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 21, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expedit saepe, ut in statuis atque picturis videmus, variari habitus, vultus, status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illo statu Chabrias sibi statuam fieri voluerit. Ex quo factum est ut postea athletae his statibus in statuis ponendis uterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—And of images in a dream: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi prima (imago somni) perit, alioque est altera nata inde statu, prior hic gestum mutasse videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(opp. motus, incessus) quorum (iratorum) vultus, voces, motus statusque mutantur,</quote> <trans><tr>motions and postures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decorum istud in corporis motu et statu cernitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus oris et vultūs, status, motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:17:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 17, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 17, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus si peccetur ... motu statuve deformi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo erant vultu, oratione, omni reliquo motu et statu, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status, incessus, sessio, accubatio ... teneat illud decorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pedibus observentur status et incessus,</quote> <trans><tr>the posture and gait</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.2" n="B" level="2"> Of external appearance, <hi rend="ital">manners</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dress</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">apparel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam formam hujus cepi in me et statum, decet et facta moresque hujus habere me similis item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redegitque se ad pallium et crepidas, atque in tali statu biennio fere permansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stature</hi> of living and inanimate beings (cf. statura; <cit><quote lang="la">post-Aug.): pumilionem, quos natura brevi statu peractos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:58" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 58</bibl></cit>: longissimum ... aratorem faciemus; <cit><quote lang="la">mediastenus qualiscunque status potest esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gallinaceis maribus status altior quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12" default="NO">7, 12</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae majoris statūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, in the phrase de statu movere, deicere, or statum conturbare, <hi rend="ital">to displace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw</hi> from a position (esp. of battle and combat): <cit><quote lang="la">equestrem procellam excitemus oportet, si turbare ac statu movere (hostes) volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil statu motus, cum projecto prae se clipeo staret, in praesidio urbis moriturum se ... respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 25</bibl></cit>: Manlius scutum scuto <cb n="STAT" /> percussit atque statum Galli conturbavit (cf. the next sentence: atque de loco hominem iterum dejecit), Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 16</bibl>.—So, out of the military sphere, in order to avoid an attack: <cit><quote lang="la">ea vis est ... quae, periculo mortis injecto, formidine animum perterritum loco saepe et certo de statu demovet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 15, 42</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of mental position, <hi rend="ital">conviction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">argument</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe adversarios de statu omni dejecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:37:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 37, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas quo est major, eo magis mentem e suā sede et statu demovet,</quote> <trans><tr>throws the mind off its balance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—Similarly: de statu deducere, recedere, <hi rend="ital">from one's position</hi> or <hi rend="ital">principles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecerunt etiam ut me prope de vitae meae statu deducerent, ut ego istum accusarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque de statu nobis nostrae dignitatis est recedendum, neque sine nostris copiis in alterius praesidia veniendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—So, de statu suo declinare = moveri: <cit><quote lang="la">neque dubito quin, suspitione aliquā perculsi repentinā, de statu suo declinarint,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>became unsettled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 38, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum me firmissimis opibus ... munire possim, quamvis excipere fortunam malui quam ... de meo statu declinare,</quote> <trans><tr>than abandon my position</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the position of heavenly bodies: qui eodem statu caeli et stellarum nati sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>aspect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 44, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n45298.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumstances.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45298.6" n="A" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">condition in regard to public rights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">political</hi> or <hi rend="ital">civil status</hi>, any loss of which was a capitis deminutio (v. caput): <cit><quote lang="la">capitis minutio est statūs permutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Dig. 4:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Dig. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inst. 1, 159</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:5:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quisque loco nostrum est natus ... hunc vitae statum usque ad senectutem obtinere debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quem proscripti confluebant. Quippe nullum habentibus statum quilibet dux erat idoneus,</quote> <trans><tr>with regard to the civil death of the proscribed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:72:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 72, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illorum salus omnibus accepta fuit ... quia tam grati exoptatum libertatis statum recuperaverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:26" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si statu periclitari litigator videtur,</quote> <trans><tr>if his civil status seems in peril</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla tam familiaris est infelicibus patria quam solitudo et prioris statūs oblivio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the status of full citizenship</tr>, <tr>lost by banishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permanent tamen in statu servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetuit quaeri de cujusquam defunctorum statu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum excisi status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: qui illegitime concipiuntur, statum sumunt ex eo tempore quo nascuntur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">whether freemen or slaves</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:89" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum servus manumittitur: eo die enim incipit statum habere,</quote> <trans><tr>a civil status</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:5:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo liber qui se vendidit, manumissus non ad suum statum revertitur, sed efficitur libertinae condicionis, i. e. that of an ingenuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:21" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo de personarum statu dicemus,</quote> <trans><tr>civil status</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de statu hominum (sometimes status used in the jurists absolutely with reference to freedom and slavery): si status controversiam cui faciat procurator, sive ex servitute in libertatem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:39:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 39, § 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:33:section=1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 3, 33, § 1</bibl>.—Similarly in the later jurists: status suus = aetas XXV. annorum, <hi rend="ital">years of discretion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad statum suum frater pervenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:77:section=19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 77, § 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Condition</hi> and <hi rend="ital">position</hi> with reference to rank, profession, trade, occupation, social standing, reputation, and character: <cit><quote lang="la">an tibi vis inter istas vorsarier prosedas ... quae tibi olant stabulum statumque?</quote> <trans><tr>their trade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in civitatibus agnationibus familiarum distinguuntur status,</quote> <trans><tr>the ranks of the families</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum status decemviris donabantur,</quote> <trans><tr>the rank of kings was assigned to the decemvirs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alii rem ipsam publicam atque hunc bonorum statum odissent,</quote> <trans><tr>the social position of the higher classes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut aliquid ex pristino statu nostro retineamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquis umquam tam ex amplo statu concidit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim jam quam dignitatem, quos honores, quem vitae statum amiserim cogito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (statuam) esse ejusdem status amictus, anulus, imago ipsa declarat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium petebamus ex potentissimi viri benevolentiā ad omnem statum nostrae dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cb n="STAT" /> noster autem status est hic: <cit><quote lang="la">apud bonos iidem sumus quos reliquisti, apud sordem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me non putem tueri meum statum ut neque offendam animum cujusquam, nec frangam dignitatem meam?</quote> <trans><tr>maintain my character</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos fortuna in amplissimo statu (i. e. regum) collocarat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam in eodem homine varietatem status,</quote> <trans><tr>high and low position in life</tr>, <tr>ups and downs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum classiarios quos Nero ex remigibus justos milites fecerat, redire ad pristinum statum cogeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam circa omnium ordinum statum correxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum redieritis in Graeciam, praestabo ne quis statum suum vestro credat esse meliorem,</quote> <trans><tr>social position</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis Aristippum decuit color et status et res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Condition</hi> in reference to prosperity, happiness or unhappiness, and health (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">at iste non dolendi status non vocatur voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque hic est Nunc status Aurorae meritos ut poscat honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebilis ut noster status est, ita flebile carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim status hic a funere differt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pejor ab admonitu fit status iste boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:2:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his enim quorum felicior in domo status fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin nostros status sive proximorum ingenia contemplemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum contemplare: vix tamen ibi talem statum (i. e. felicitatis deorum) reperias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quidem (vox) animi magnifici et prosperi status (fuit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">obliti statūs ejus quem beneficio exuistis meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumus in hoc tuo statu iidem qui florente te fuimus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>distress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res magna et ex beatissimo animi statu profecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 81, 21</bibl></cit>: voverat, si sibi incolumis status (of <hi rend="ital">health</hi>) permisisset, proditurum se ... hydraulam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 54</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45298.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumstances</hi>, in gen., of life or of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">homines hoc uno plurimum a bestiis differunt quod rationem habent, mentemque quae ... omnem complectatur vitae consequentis statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facias me certiorem et simul de toto statu tuo consiliisque omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi declaravi adventus noster qualis fuisset, et quis esset status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim ego laboravi, si ... nihil consecutus sum ut in eo statu essem quem neque fortunae temeritas, neque, etc., labefactaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hoc videant ii qui nulla sibi subsidia ad omnes vitae status paraverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: atque is quidem qui cuncta composuit constanter in suo manebat statu (transl. of <foreign lang="greek">e)/meinen e)n tw=| e(autou= kata\ tro/pon h)/qei</foreign>, Plat. Tim. p. 42, c. Steph.), <hi rend="ital">in his own state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">being</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tim. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae statum commutatum ferre non potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id suis rebus tali in statu saluti fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: haec sunt fulmina quae prima accepto patrimonio et in novi hominis aut urbis statu fiunt, <hi rend="ital">in any new condition</hi> (when a stroke of lightning was considered an omen), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 47</bibl>.—Rarely of a state: <cit><quote lang="la">libere hercle hoc quidem. Sed vide statum (i. e. ebrietatis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in augury: fulmen status, <hi rend="ital">a thunderbolt sent to one who is not expecting a sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a warning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suggestion</hi>, = fulmen monitorium: <cit><quote lang="la">status est, ubi quietis nec agitantibus quidquam nec cogitantibus fulmen intervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:39:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 39, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.10" n="B" level="2"> Of countries, communities, etc., <hi rend="ital">the condition of society</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the public order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public affairs.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45298.11" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliam ita vexavit ac perdidit ut ea restitui in antiquum statum nullo modo possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc in eo statu civitas est ut omnes idem de re publicā sensuri esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem condicionem imperii tui statumque provinciae mihi demonstravit Tratorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 68, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi rei publicae statum per te notum esse voluisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">status ipse nostrae civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non erat desperandum fore aliquem tolerabilem statum civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane bonum rei publicae genus, sed tamen inclinatum et quasi pronum ad perniciosissimum statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 26, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo, si non bono, at saltem certo statu civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc qui sit status totius rei publicae videre potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: ex eodem de toto statu rerum communium<pb n="1756" /> <cb n="STAT" />  cognosces, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen illa, quae requiris, suum statum tenent, nec melius, si tu adesses, tenerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non illi nos de unius municipis fortunis arbitrantur, sed de totius municipii statu, dignitate, etc., sententias esse laturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 69, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vitam omnium civium, statum orbis terrae ... redemi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ti. Gracchum mediocriter labefactantem statum rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo tum statu res erat ut longe principes haberentur Aedui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc in statu res esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam regiam servitutem (civitatis) collatam cum praesenti statu praeclaram libertatem visam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statum quoque civitatis ea victoria firmavit ut jam inde res inter se contrahere auderent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>commercial prosperity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut deliberare de statu rerum suarum posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut taedio praesentium consules duo et status pristinus rerum in desiderium veniant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam Latio is status erat rerum ut neque bellum neque pacem pati possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se moverit ad sollicitandum statum civitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>internal peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni praesenti statu spem cuique novandi res suas blandiorem esse,</quote> <trans><tr>more attractive than any condition of public affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillitatis status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sollicito civitatis statu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes regesque et quocumque alio nomine sunt tutores status publici,</quote> <trans><tr>guardians of public order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: curis omnium ad formandum publicum statum a tam sollemni munere aversis, Curt, 10, 10, 9; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad formandum rerum praesentium statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo jam praesenti statu laeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad componendum Orientis statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deploravit temporum statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad explorandum statum Galliarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delegatus pacandae Germaniae status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 16</bibl></cit>: et omnia habet rerum status iste mearum (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, = reipublicae meae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 509</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.12" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of the political sentiments of the citizens: <cit><quote lang="la">a Maronitis certiora de statu civitatium scituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad visendum statum regionis ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas quoque in eodem statu mansuras res esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hic status in Boeotiā esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 56, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of the constitution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">institutions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form of government</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionem rogemus ut explicet quem existimet esse optimum statum civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:20:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 20, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 21, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 46, 70</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 47, 71: ob hanc causam praestare nostrae civitatis statum ceteris civitatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque cum patres rerum potirentur, numquam constitisse statum civitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>the form of the government had never been permanent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc statu rei publicae (decemvirali), quem dixi non posse esse diuturnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 37, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">providete ne rei publicae status commutetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:27:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 27, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eademque oritur etiam ex illo saepe optimatium praeclaro statu,</quote> <trans><tr>aristocratic form of government</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut totum statum civitatis in hoc uno judicio positam esse putetis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rei publicae statum convulsuri viderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro meā salute, pro vestrā auctoritate, pro statu civitatis nullum vitae discrimen vitandum umquam putavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc coire ausus es, ut consularem dignitatem, ut rei publicae statum ... addiceres?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae sunt in imperio et in statu civitatis ab iis defendi putantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intelleges (te habere) nihil quod aut hoc aut aliquo rei publicae statu timeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad statum Macedoniae pertinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex commutatione statūs publici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec oblivio concussum et labentem civitatis statum in pristinum habitum revocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchi civitatis statum conati erant convellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero ita legibus Sullae cohaerere statum civitatis affirmat ut his solutis stare ipsa non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eloquentiā turbaverant civitatium status vel everterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id biduum quod de mutando reipublicae statu haesitatum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dissimulasse unquam pristinum se reipublicae statum restituturum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conversus hieme ad ordinandum reipublicae statum, fastos correxit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu civitatem quis deceat status Curas,</quote> <trans><tr>what institutions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29</bibl></cit>, <cb n="STEL" /> 25.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45298.14" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Existence of the republic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae lex ad imperium, ad majestatem, ad statum patriae, ad salutem omnium pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 29, 70</bibl></cit> (= eo, ut stet patria, <hi rend="ital">the country's existence</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">si enim status erit aliquis civitatis, quicunque erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: status enim rei publicae maxime judicatis rebus continetur, <hi rend="ital">the existence of the republic depends on the decisions of the courts</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">their sacredness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 22, 63</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45298.15" n="C" level="2"> In nature, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">incolumitatis ac salutis omnium causā videmus hunc statum esse hujus totius mundi atque naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:45:178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 45, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alio alius status (i. e. mundi) excipere omnia debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 829</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alio terram status excipit alter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:835" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 835</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est etiam quoque pacatus status aëris ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non expectato solis ortu, ex quo statum caeli notare gubernatores possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem (mare) alio caeli statu recipit in se fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertus status caeli,</quote> <bibl
