n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluvius caeli status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitior caeli status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 1054" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 1054</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.16" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The characteristic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">essential feature</hi> of a thing. </sense><sense id="n45298.17" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hoc loquor de tribus his generibus rerum publicarum non perturbatis atque permixtis, sed suum statum tenentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>preserving their essential features</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 28, 44</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45298.18" n="2" level="3"> Esp. in rhet. jurisp. </sense><sense id="n45298.19" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The answer to the action</hi> (acc. to Cic., because the defence: primum insistit in eo = the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sta/sis</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">refutatio accusationis appellatur Latine status, in quo primum insistit quasi ad repugnandum congressa defensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:25:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 25, 93</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">statu (sic enim appellamus controversiarum genera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:33:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 33, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statum quidam dixerunt primam causarum conflictionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 29, 102</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.20" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The main question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the essential point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nos statum id quidam constitutionem vocant, alii quaestionem, alii quod ex quaestione appareat, Theodorus caput, ad quod referantur omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est status prima conflictio, sed quod ex primā conflictione nascitur, id est genus quaestionis,</quote> <trans><tr>the kind</tr>, <tr>nature of the question</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. the whole chapter.—</sense><sense id="n45298.21" n="E" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">the mood of the verb</hi>, instead of modus, because it distinguishes the conceptions of the speaker: <cit><quote lang="la">et tempora et status,</quote> <trans><tr>tenses and moods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiunt soloecismi per modos, sive cui status eos dici placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 41</bibl></cit>.!*? For <orth extent="full" lang="la">statu liber</orth>, v. statuliber.</sense></entryFree>
statutio: <entryFree id="n45299" type="hapax" key="sta^tu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>statuo</etym>, <sense id="n45299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a placing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erecting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
statutum: <entryFree id="n45300" type="main" key="sta^tu_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūtum</orth>, v. statuo <sense id="n45300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
statutus: <entryFree id="n45301" type="main" key="sta^tu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from statuo.</entryFree>
staures: <entryFree id="n45302" type="main" key="Staures"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Staures</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the Caspian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
steatitis: <entryFree id="n45303" type="greek" key="ste^a^ti_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕătītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">steati=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n45303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown; perhaps <hi rend="ital">soapstone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steatite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 71, § 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
steatoma: <entryFree id="n45304" type="greek" key="ste^a^to_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕătōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stea/twma</foreign>, <sense id="n45304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fatty tumor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 14, 87, § 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 30, 1</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 6</bibl>, written in Greek).</sense></entryFree>
stega: <entryFree id="n45305" type="greek" key="ste^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ste/gh</foreign>, <sense id="n45305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the deck</hi> of a ship, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
steganos: <entryFree id="n45306" type="main" key="Ste^ga^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕgănos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stegano/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the channels by which the city of Alexandria had access to the sea.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 34, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stegnus: <entryFree id="n45307" type="greek" key="stegnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stegnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">stegno/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drawing together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">costive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">febres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stela: <entryFree id="n45308" type="greek" key="ste_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sth/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n45308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pillar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:174" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 29, 34, § 174</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stelephuros: <entryFree id="n45309" type="greek" key="ste^le^phu_ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕlĕphūros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stelefou=ros</foreign>, <sense id="n45309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">Ravenna sugar-cane</hi>: Saccharum Ravennae, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 61, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stelis: <entryFree id="n45310" type="greek" key="ste^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">steli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mistletoe that grows upon firs and larches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 93, § 245</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stella: <entryFree id="n45311" type="main" key="stella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for sterula; cf. Sanscr. staras; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)sth/r</foreign>; Germ. Stern; Engl. star; perh. root ster- of sterno; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">store/nnumi</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n45311.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a star</hi> (whereas sidus denotes a group of stars, a constellation; v. sidus; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also astrum): ignes, quae sidera et stellas vocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt stellae naturā flammeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>: o magna templa caelitum commixta stellis splendidis Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 6</bibl> <cb n="STEL" /> Müll. (Trag. v. 227 Vahl.); cf.: caelum stellis fulgentibus aptum, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 30 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 357</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae in radiis solis (non cernuntur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime sunt admirabiles motus earum quinque stellarum, quae falso vocantur errantes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>planets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 51</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">errantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:13:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 13, 34</bibl> (but cf. inerrantes, <hi rend="ital">fixed stars</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20, 51</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">stella comans,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a comet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 749</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:850" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 850</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum caelum stellas vehat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:66" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul alba nautis Stella refulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam stellarum sublime coëgerat agmen Lucifer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 97</bibl></cit>: usque ad diurnam stellam, <hi rend="ital">Lucifer</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">till daybreak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 64</bibl>.—Prov., of an impossibility: <cit><quote lang="la">Terra feret stellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, sometimes for sidus, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Coronae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesani Leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Icarii stella proterva canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella miluus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:793" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 793</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 112</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the sun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella serena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:718" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 718</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45311.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a meteor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shooting-star</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe stellas videbis Praecipites caelo labi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de caelo lapsa per umbras Stella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 694</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 208</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discursus stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 36, 36, § 100</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">discurrere eae (stellae) videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 80, § 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmus ergo stellarum longos a tergo albescere tractus. Hae velut stellae exsiliunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:14:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 14, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n45311.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things resembling a star. </sense><sense id="n45311.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A figure of a star</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis in stellam dividatur ... refert jugum in stellam decussari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 17, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:3" default="NO">4, 26, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 13, 13</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 23, § 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamys distincta aureis stellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45311.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bright point</hi> on a precious stone, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:134" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 9, 51, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:182" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 67, § 182</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45311.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A starfish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 60, 86, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4</bibl></cit> (6), 12, 3.—</sense><sense id="n45311.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A glowworm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 27, 67, § 251</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n45311.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The pupil</hi> of the eye, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 1, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stellans: <entryFree id="n45312" type="main" key="stellans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stellans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, v. stello, I.</entryFree>
stellaris: <entryFree id="n45313" type="main" key="stella_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stellāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stella</etym>, <sense id="n45313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a star</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starry</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">essentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
stellatinus: <entryFree id="n45314" type="main" key="Stella_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stellātīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Stellatis.</entryFree>
stellatisager: <entryFree id="n45315" type="main" key="Stella_tis a^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stellātis ăger</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">campus</orth>, <sense id="n45315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Southern Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Cales</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:268" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 268</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stellātīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> ager Stellatis: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=343" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 343</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 35, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">484, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stellatura: <entryFree id="n45316" type="main" key="stella_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stellātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deduction from the soldiers' rations granted to the military tribunes</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Pescenn. 3</bibl>; Lampr<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Alex. Sev. 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; Cod. Th. 7, 4, 28, § 1 al.</sense></entryFree>
stellatus: <entryFree id="n45317" type="main" key="stella_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stellātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. stello, II.</entryFree>
stellifer: <entryFree id="n45318" type="main" key="stelli^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stellĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stella-fero</etym>, <sense id="n45318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">star-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starry</hi> (very rare): caeli stellifer cursus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 785" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stelliger: <entryFree id="n45319" type="main" key="stelli^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stellĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stella-gero</etym>, <sense id="n45319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">star-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starry</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): viae stelligerae aetheris, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 299, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=238" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 238</bibl></cit> (482): <cit><quote lang="la">polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:565" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 3, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1907" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1907</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:863" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 863</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stellimicans: <entryFree id="n45320" type="hapax" key="stelli^mi^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stellĭmĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stellamico</etym>, <sense id="n45320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glittering with stars</hi>: signa, Varr. ap. Prob. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stellio: <entryFree id="n45321" type="main" key="stelli^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stellĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stēlĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stella</etym>. <sense id="n45321.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A newt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stellion</hi> (having star-like spots on its back): Lacerto gecko, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 28, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:91" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 26, 31, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45321.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a crafty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knavish person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 172, 19</bibl>; cf. stellionatus.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45322" type="main" key="Stellio2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stellio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. stellio</etym>, <sense id="n45322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. C. Afranius Stellio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 23, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stellionatus: <entryFree id="n45323" type="main" key="stelli^o_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stellĭōnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. stellio, B.</etym>, <sense id="n45323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cozenage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trickery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stellionate</hi> (jurid. Lat.): stellionatum obici posse his, qui dolo quid fecerunt sciendum est, scilicet si aliud crimen non sit, quod obiciatur; <cit><quote lang="la">quod enim in privatis judiciis est de dolo actio, hoc in criminibus stellionatus persecutio. Ubicumque igitur titulus criminis deficit, illic stellionatum obiciemus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:20:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 20, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:36" default="NO">13, 7, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:29" default="NO">17, 1, 29</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 40, 7, 9. <pb n="1757" /> <cb n="STEP" /></sense></entryFree>
stello: <entryFree id="n45324" type="main" key="stello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stello</orth>, no <sense id="n45324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [stella]. </sense><sense id="n45324.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covered with stars.</hi> So only in the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> stellans, antis, <hi rend="ital">bestarred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starry</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">caelo stellante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 212</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta summi patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:623" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympus, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 12, 19: nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 1:11:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora Tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:603" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 603</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45324.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmis caudam (pavonis) stellantibus implet,</quote> <trans><tr>glittering</tr>, <tr>shining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 723</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegmina (i. e. vestes),</quote> <trans><tr>gleaming</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:98" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina (i. e. oculi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 2:499" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volatus (cicindelarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 66, § 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <trans><tr>covered as it were with stars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:29:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universa armis stellantibus coruscabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45324.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cover with stars;</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> only post-Aug. and very rare (cf. <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> infra): <cit><quote lang="la">quis caelum stellet fomes, Mart. Cap. poët. 2, § 118 (al. qui caelum stellet formis, Gron. p. 29): (gemmae) stellarum Hyadum et numero et dispositione stellantur,</quote> <trans><tr>are set with stars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 28, § 100</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa vero pars materiae digna laudari quanto verborum stellatur auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:11" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood> and <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stellātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">set with stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stellate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starred</hi> (class.): stellatus Cepheus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">placed in the heavens as a constellation</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:42" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus (deorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Hon. 4, 209</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45324.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellatus Argus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>many-eyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 664</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:277" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 277</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaspide fulvā Ensis,</quote> <trans><tr>sparkling</tr>, <tr>glittering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">variis stellatus corpora guttis,</quote> <trans><tr>thickly set</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma auratis guttis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal stellatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 67, 86, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 6, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellatis axibus agger,</quote> <trans><tr>star-shaped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:109" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 455</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stellula: <entryFree id="n45325" type="main" key="stellu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stellŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little star</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asterisk</hi>, as a mark in writing; <cit><quote lang="la">the Lat. word for asteriscus (late Lat.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 112, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stemma: <entryFree id="n45326" type="greek" key="stemma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stemma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ste/mma</foreign>. <sense id="n45326.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a garland</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wreath</hi> (post-class.), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 908; Firm. Math. 3, 8.—</sense><sense id="n45326.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a garland</hi> hung upon an ancestral image (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:28:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45326.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pedigree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genealogical table</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genealogical tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 44:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 44, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:43" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:28" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:35:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 35, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45326.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">nobility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti fumosa sui stemmata narrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">referre prisci jejunii,</quote> <trans><tr>the great antiquity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stena: <entryFree id="n45327" type="main" key="Ste^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stena/</foreign>, <sense id="n45327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a narrow defile near Antigonea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Chaonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stenocoriasis: <entryFree id="n45328" type="greek" key="ste^no^co^ri^a^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕnŏcŏrĭăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stenokori/asis</foreign>, <sense id="n45328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contraction of the pupil</hi>, a disease of the eyes of horses, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stentor: <entryFree id="n45329" type="main" key="Stentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stentor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ste/ntwr</foreign>, <sense id="n45329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek warrior in the army before Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for the strength of his lungs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:112" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 112</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stentŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Stentorian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">loud-sounding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stephane: <entryFree id="n45330" type="main" key="Ste^pha^ne_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕphănē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stefa/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n45330.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ancient name of the island of Samos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 37, § 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45330.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name of the city of Prœneste</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45331" type="main" key="Ste^pha^ne_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕphănē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stefa/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n45331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stephaneplocos: <entryFree id="n45332" type="main" key="Ste^pha^ne_plo^cos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕphănēplŏcos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stefanhplo/kos</foreign>, <sense id="n45332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Chaplet-wreather</hi>, a picture by Pausias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 2, 3, § 4</bibl>.— Called also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕphănŏpōlĭs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stefano/pwlis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Chaplet-seller</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stephanio: <entryFree id="n45333" type="main" key="Ste^pha^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕphănĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mime of the time of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stephanitis: <entryFree id="n45334" type="greek" key="ste^pha^ni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕphănītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stefani=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n45334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which winds about in the shape of garlands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Called also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕphănītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stefani/ths</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stephanium: <entryFree id="n45335" type="main" key="Ste^pha^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕphănĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> of Stephane, <sense id="n45335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a character in the Stichus of Plautus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:54 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 54 al.</bibl>—Called also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕphă-niscĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stephanomelis: <entryFree id="n45336" type="greek" key="ste^pha^no^me^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕphănŏmĕlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant which checks bleeding at the nose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 13, 84, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stephanopolis: <entryFree id="n45337" type="main" key="Ste^pha^no^polis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕphănŏpolis</orth>, v. Stephaneplocos. <cb n="STER" /></entryFree>
stephanos: <entryFree id="n45338" type="greek" key="ste^pha^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕphănos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ste/fanos</foreign> (garland), <sense id="n45338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several plants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aphrodites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stephanus: <entryFree id="n45339" type="main" key="Ste^pha^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕphănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ste/fanos</foreign>, <sense id="n45339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stephanusa: <entryFree id="n45340" type="main" key="Stepha^nu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stephănūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stefanou=sa</foreign>, <sense id="n45340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the female Chaplet-wreather</hi>, a little statue of Praxiteles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 70</bibl> Jan. and Sillig. (al. Stephusa, of the same meaning).</sense></entryFree>
sterceia: <entryFree id="n45341" type="main" key="sterce_ia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stercēia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stercus</etym>, <sense id="n45341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maidservant who cleans the excrements from children</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 8</bibl>.—As a nickname, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75, 9</bibl> (al. sterteja).</sense></entryFree>
stercorarius: <entryFree id="n45342" type="main" key="sterco^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stercŏrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to dung</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: porta, <hi rend="ital">a gate in the temple of Vesta</hi> (v. stercus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 344</bibl> Müll.; cf. Bunsen's Rome, 3, p. 12.</sense></entryFree>
stercoratio: <entryFree id="n45343" type="main" key="sterco^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stercŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stercoro</etym>, <sense id="n45343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dunging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manuring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:2" default="NO">2, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 23, 53, § 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stercoratus: <entryFree id="n45344" type="main" key="sterco^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stercŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. stercoro.</entryFree>
stercoreus: <entryFree id="n45345" type="hapax" key="sterco^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stercŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stercus</etym>, <sense id="n45345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dungy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles, as a term of abuse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stercoro: <entryFree id="n45346" type="main" key="sterco^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stercŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45346.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To dung</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manure with dung</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to muck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 305</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45346.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cleanse from dung</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercorata colluvies,</quote> <trans><tr>dungheap</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 24</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">stercŏ-rātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">dunged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mucked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus stercoratissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:85" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:8" default="NO">2, 11, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stercorosus: <entryFree id="n45347" type="main" key="sterco^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stercŏrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of excrements</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dung</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well manured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>full of filth</tr>, <tr>impure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:26:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 26, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:43" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sterculinium: <entryFree id="n45348" type="main" key="stercu^li_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stercŭlīnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sterquilinium.</entryFree>
sterculius: <entryFree id="n45349" type="main" key="Stercu^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stercŭlĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stercus</etym>, <sense id="n45349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the deity that presides over manuring</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 21</bibl>.—Called also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stercŭ-lus</orth>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 450; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stercŭtus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stercŭtĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 36</bibl>; and, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stercenĭus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 850</bibl>; cf. Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 15; and Becker, Ant. 4, p. 16.</sense></entryFree>
stercus: <entryFree id="n45350" type="main" key="stercus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stercus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skw/r</foreign>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">skato/s</foreign>, dung; Sanscr. cakrt = sakart</etym>. <sense id="n45350.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dung</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excrements</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordure</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">fimus, merda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:11 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 11 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 344</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 32</bibl> ib., and Fest. s. v. Quando stercus, pp. 258 and 259 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 64</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum in stercore quaerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Lit. 1, p. 510</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45350.1" n="b" level="4"> As a term of abuse: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo stercus curiae dici Glauciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45350.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dross</tr>, <tr>slag</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 188" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stercutius: <entryFree id="n45351" type="main" key="Stercu^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stercŭtĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stercŭtus</orth>, v. Sterculius.</entryFree>
sterelytis: <entryFree id="n45352" type="greek" key="sterely_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sterelȳtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of scum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">litharge of silver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stereobata: <entryFree id="n45353" type="greek" key="ste^re^o^ba^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĕŏbăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stereoba/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n45353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pedestal</hi> of a column or row of columns, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stergethron: <entryFree id="n45354" type="greek" key="sterge_thron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stergēthron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ste/rghqron</foreign>, <sense id="n45354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great houseleek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
steria: <entryFree id="n45355" type="main" key="Ste_ria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stēria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*steiri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n45355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stericula: <entryFree id="n45356" type="hapax" key="ste_ri^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stērĭcŭla</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, <sense id="n45356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the uterus of a sow that has not yet farrowed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sterigmos: <entryFree id="n45357" type="greek" key="ste_rigmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stērigmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sthrigmo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the standing-still of a planet</hi> (pure Lat. stativa lux), App. de Mundo, p. 64, 25.</sense></entryFree>
sterilefio: <entryFree id="n45358" type="hapax" key="ste^ri^le^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlĕfīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sterilis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n45358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become unfruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barren</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sterile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leaenae sterilefiunt in aeternum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> dub. (al. steriles fiunt).</sense></entryFree>
sterilesco: <entryFree id="n45359" type="main" key="ste^ri^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n45359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [sterilis], <hi rend="ital">to grow unfruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barren</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sterile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45359.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">leaenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprae pinguitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amygdalae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 10, 11, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mamma (suis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 234</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45359.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: gaudia, Val. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Dir. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sterilicula: <entryFree id="n45360" type="main" key="ste^ri^li^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = vulva sterilis, <sense id="n45360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the womb of a sow that has never borne young</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35, 3</bibl>. <cb n="STER" /></sense></entryFree>
sterilis: <entryFree id="n45361" type="main" key="ste^ri^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (collat. form, <sense id="n45361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing. fem</hi> sterilam sterilem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=316" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 316</bibl> Müll.; <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> sterila, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 845</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> sterile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:1:section=258" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 1, § 258</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stereo/s</foreign>, hard; <foreign lang="greek">steri/fh, stei=ra</foreign>, barren; Sanscr. starī, vacca sterilis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">unfruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barren</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sterile</hi>, of plants and animals (class. and very freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn infecundus): steriles nascuntur avenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ulvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">platani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit> (2, 11), 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:34" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">steriles nimium crasso sunt semine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1240</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">galli Tanagric' ad partus sunt steriliores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae (mulie res),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>eunuchs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 47, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:9:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 60, 80, § 166</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45361.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n45361.2" n="1" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">causing unfruitfulness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sterility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubigo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:68:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 68, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serere pampinariis sterile est,</quote> <trans><tr>produces sterility</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45361.3" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">barren</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilis amator a datis,</quote> <trans><tr>bare of gifts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:18:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas ad aquas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 173" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora sonitu (with jejuna succo),</quote> <trans><tr>that yield no sound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 845</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospectus,</quote> <trans><tr>without human beings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>without children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 62: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi,</quote> <trans><tr>that do not bear interest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilis laurus baccarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides plumbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45361.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unproductive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprofitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Februarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod monumentum, quod immo temporis punctum, aut beneficio sterile, aut vacuum laude?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sit sterile et effetum (saeculum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama (with cassa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:70" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:58:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 58, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unreturned</tr>, <tr>unrequited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 496</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:42" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cathedrae,</quote> <trans><tr>unprofitable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:76:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 76, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus sterili versamus aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 49</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprived of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unacquainted with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes talium studiorum fuere steriles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non adeo virtutum sterile saeculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu steriles veri!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:75" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sterilitas: <entryFree id="n45362" type="main" key="ste^ri^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sterilis</etym>, <sense id="n45362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfruitfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barrenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sterility</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n45362.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sit vel sterilitas agrorum vel fertilitas futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 47, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus exstitit in sterilitate naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sterilitatem castrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 14, 36, § 136</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 8</bibl></cit> (24), 5.—* </sense><sense id="n45362.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestis sterilitas,</quote> <trans><tr>weather that causes unfruitfulness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilitas fortunae,</quote> <trans><tr>poverty</tr>, <tr>insufficiency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 4.—* </sense><sense id="n45362.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sterilitatem emarcuit (auctoritas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sterilus: <entryFree id="n45363" type="main" key="ste^ri^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sterilis <sense id="n45363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sternax: <entryFree id="n45364" type="main" key="sternax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sternax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sterno</etym>, <sense id="n45364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that throws to the ground</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans><tr>that throws his rider</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 364</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:261" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 261</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives,</quote> <trans><tr>that fall prostrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of a suppliant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sterno: <entryFree id="n45365" type="main" key="sterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sterno</orth>, <itype>strāvi, strātum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n45365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> sync. strarat, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 774</bibl>: strasset, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 86, 8</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">*s*t*o*r, store/nnumi</foreign>, to spread; <foreign lang="greek">strato/s</foreign>, camp; Sanscr. star- strnāmi = sterno; cf.: strages, struo, torus, and <itype>lātus</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, old Lat. stlatus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread abroad; to stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45365.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; in Cic. only in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">effundo, extendo, subicio, subdo): vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 658</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in duro vellus solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:654" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubulos utres ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic glarea dura Sternitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natas sub aequore virgas Sternit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>scatters</tr>, <tr>strews</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:813" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 813</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 14, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma passim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spongeas ad lunam et pruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 11</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1758" /> <cb n="STER" /> 47, § <cit><quote lang="la">123: arma per flores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessi sternunt corpora,</quote> <trans><tr>stretch out their bodies</tr>, <tr>lie down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 47, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sternunt se somno diversae in litore phocae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 432</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">sternimur optatae gremio telluris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 509</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in Capitolinas certatim scanditur arces Sternunturque Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:340" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 340</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">strātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">stretched out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostrate</hi> (syn. prostratus): strata terrae, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 20</bibl> (Trag. v. 370 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nos humi strati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam somno etiam strati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pedes strati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stratum jacere et genua complecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc viridi membra sub arbuto Stratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45365.2" n="2" level="3"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae Frisiorum, Chaucorum, etc. ... sternuntur inter Helium ac Flevum,</quote> <trans><tr>stretch out</tr>, <tr>extend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 15, 29, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, vites stratae,</quote> <trans><tr>spreading</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit> (for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 3</bibl>, v. under rarus, II. A.).—</sense><sense id="n45365.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to spread</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">out flat</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">level</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sternere aequor aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">placidi straverunt aequora venti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 763</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc omne tibi stratum silet aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stratoque super discumbitur ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam per mare,</quote> <trans><tr>smoothed</tr>, <tr>levelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1030" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1030</bibl></cit> (acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(do\n store/nnumi</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">stratum militari labore iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hoc iter Alpes, Hoc Cannae stravere tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:514" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 514</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and trop.: praesens tibi fama benignum Stravit iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:813" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 813</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45365.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (the figure borrowed from the sea), <hi rend="ital">to calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 58</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">constrata ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n45365.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45365.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover over</hi> (by spreading something out; the predom. class. signif. of the word; cf. obtendo). </sense><sense id="n45365.7" n="1" level="3"> Of a couch, bed, etc., <hi rend="ital">to spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus vestimentis stratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">strata cubilia sunt herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogatus est a Maximo, ut triclinium sterneret ... Atque ille stravit pelliculis haedinis lectulos Punicanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lectum, lectos, biclinium, triclinia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:51" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his foliis cubitus sternere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torum frondibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strata cathedra,</quote> <trans><tr>cushioned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. also, ARCERAM NE STERNITO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 25</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet sterni sibi in primā domus parte (sc. lectum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45365.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., places, <hi rend="ital">to cover;</hi> of a way, road, path, etc., <hi rend="ital">to pave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspreta erant strata saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via strata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semitam saxo quadrato straverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vias silice ... clivum Capitolinum silice ... emporium lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 27, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum illum sternendum locare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimentum stratum lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:40:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 40, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45365.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To saddle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 20, 12</bibl></cit>;
